String.Source: Put the Fusion Core in the Power Armor
Put the Fusion Core in the Power Armor

String.Dest: Připoj se k Prestonu Garveymu v Sanctuary

String.Source: Swing at a target to deliver a melee attack with any ranged weapon.
String.Dest: Pro úder zblízka jakoukoliv zbraní máchni směrem na nepřítele.

String.Source: Using a scope slows you down, but improves your accuracy.
String.Dest: Míření s optikou tě sice zpomalí, ale také zvýší tvoji přesnost.

String.Source: To use a grenade or Molotov cocktail, first equip it, hold Sneak, then throw!
String.Dest: Pokud chceš použít granát nebo Molotovův koktejl, nejdřív se jimi vybav, podrž tlačítko pro plížení a házej!

String.Source:
Terminals containing useful information will often be locked with a password. Hack them to access their contents.
Locked terminals range in difficulty: novice, advanced, expert, and master. Unlocking terminals above novice difficulty requires ranks of the "Hacker" perk.
To hack a terminal, approach it and press [WTPad_Center]. The terminal will display a list of potential passwords and random characters. Only one word listed is the correct password.
Move the cursor by swping [WTPad_Any] to select a word. Press [WTrigger] to attempt to use that word as the password.
If the selection is correct, the terminal will unlock.
If the selection is wrong, "Entry denied" and a "Likeness" number will be displayed in the corner of the terminal screen.
The Likeness number tells you how many letters in your attempted password match exactly (both letter and position) to the actual password. Use this information to narrow your search by comparing the letters of your attempted password to the remaining options.
As you move your cursor through the lists of characters, you may find a group that highlights. Selecting these and pressing [WTrigger] may remove a dud word or reset your number of attempts.
You have four attempts to select the right password. If you fail to find the correct entry after four attempts, you'll be locked out of the terminal for 10 seconds.
You can press [WGrip] at any time to exit the terminal.
Terminals that are owned display red unlock text. Hacking an owned terminal is a crime. If you are detected, nearby onlookers will become hostile to you.
String.Dest:

Locked terminals range in difficulty: novice, advanced, expert, and master. Unlocking terminals above novice difficulty requires ranks of the "Hacker" perk.

If the selection is correct, the terminal will unlock.
If the selection is wrong, "Entry denied" and a "Likeness" number will be displayed in the corner of the terminal screen.
The Likeness number tells you how many letters in your attempted password match exactly (both letter and position) to the actual password. Use this information to narrow your search by comparing the letters of your attempted password to the remaining options.
As you move your cursor through the lists of characters, you may find a group that highlights. Selecting these and pressing [WTrigger] may remove a dud word or reset your number of attempts.

String.Source:
Certain workshop objects won't function without someone to work them, and that requires workers.
Some workshops will already have workers available when you gain access to them. To attract new workers to your workshop, build a Recruitment Radio Beacon (Power > Miscellaneous).
To assign a friendly worker to a workshop object, hold [LWMenu] to enter the Workshop menu, highlight a settler, and press [RWTPad_Center] to put the settler into Command mode. Then highlight an object (or bed) and press [RWTPad_Center] again to assign the settler to it.
In some cases, a settler can only work on a single object (stores, for example). However, settlers can work on multiple Food- and Defense-producing objects at once. When you assign a settler to work at a Food or Defense object, they will automatically begin working at any objects without a worker of the same type.
Highlighting a settler will also highlight any objects they are currently assigned to, so you can see what they are currently working on.
String.Dest:

String.Source: You must exit your Power Armor before modifying it. Hold [RWTPad_Center] to exit.
String.Dest: You must exit your Power Armor before modifying it. Hold [RWTPad_Center] to exit.

String.Source:
Mods are special attachments or adjustments made to weapons, armor, and Power Armor that can increase the item's stats, change its material, or provide beneficial effects.
You can check out your gear's existing mods or build new ones at Weapons and Armor workbenches and at Power Armor stations - known collectively as "modding stations."
New mods can also be purchased from weapon and armor merchants.
Modding Stations Major settlements will often have a collection of modding stations near their markets. To use a modding station, approach it and press [WTPad_Center].
Move between items by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. To select an item, press [WTrigger].
Mods and Slots Most items have a variety of slots that can be modded. Select a slot with [WTrigger] to enter that slot's Mods Page.
The Mods page lists all mods available for the selected slot. Any currently attached mods will have small square next to their name. The names of any mods you've previously acquired or have the resources to build will be lighter.
You can attach a new mod with [WTrigger].
Each slot can only contain one mod at a time.
Building Mods Building a new mod requires components. Some advanced mods also require certain perks. Components are harvested from Junk Items found in the world (steel from cans, springs from clocks, etc.).
If you have items that contain the components required for a given mod in your inventory or in storage at the modding station you're using, select the mod and press [WTrigger] to build it instantly. This will consume those items and craft your mod.
Tagging Components If you don't have the necessary components, you can tag a mod for search by selecting it on the Mods page and pressing [WTPad_Right]. Any items in the world containing components for your tagged mod will be marked with a small magnifying glass when approached.
You can also tag components in the Pip-Boy. Open the Inventory (INV) tab, head to the Junk section and press[WTPad_Center], then select COMPONENT VIEW to enter Component view. Select the component you'd like to tag and press [WTPad_Right].
Scrapping Weapons and armor you've collected can also be harvested for components through scrapping.
To scrap an item, select it on the modding station Inventory page and press [WTPad_Left] to convert it and any attached mods into components. Scrapping an item destroys it and any mods attached to it permanently.
Repairing Power Armor Along with building mods, Power Armor stations allow you to repair damaged Power Armor pieces. You can repair an armor piece from the station Inventory page by selecting it and pressing [WTPad_Left], but only if you have the necessary components.
Renaming Gear Weapons and Armor workbenches allow you to rename your gear. From the workbench's Inventory page, press [WTPad_Right] to rename the selected weapon or armor.
You cannot rename Power Armor pieces.
Storage You can store items in a modding station by approaching the station and pressing [RWTPad_Up] to open the station's Transfer menu. When crafting a mod, items stored in a modding station will be harvested for components before items in your inventory.
For more info on how to use the Transfer menu, check out the "Containers" entry.

String.Source: Your head has been crippled! Heal yourself with a Stimpak!
String.Dest: Your head has been crippled! Heal yourself with a Stimpak!

String.Source:
CRAFTING STATIONS Craft stat-boosting chems or health-restoring food recipies at Cooking and Chemistry stations.
Preparing a recipe requires ingredients, which can be found in the world or purchased from merchants.
If you have a recipe's ingredients, select it and press [WTrigger] to craft it. Required ingredients will be harvested automatically from your inventory (or from storage in this crafting station).
If you don't have the necessary ingredients, select the recipe and press [WTpad_Right] to tag it for search. Ingredients for that recipe will now appear in the world with a magnifying glass next to their name.
String.Dest:
CRAFTING STATIONS Craft stat-boosting chems or health-restoring food recipies at Cooking and Chemistry stations.
Preparing a recipe requires ingredients, which can be found in the world or purchased from merchants.
If you have a recipe's ingredients, select it and press [WTrigger] to craft it. Required ingredients will be harvested automatically from your inventory (or from storage in this crafting station).
If you don't have the necessary ingredients, select the recipe and press [WTpad_Right] to tag it for search. Ingredients for that recipe will now appear in the world with a magnifying glass next to their name.

String.Source:
Every time you use chems or drink alcohol, there is a chance you could become addicted. Every addiction you acquire will inflict a stat penalty (the penalty varies based on the chem involved).
Consuming the item you're addicted to will temporarily remove the penalty, but to get rid of it permanently, you'll have to visit a doctor or take the medicine Addictol.
String.Dest:
Pokaždé, když požiješ drogy nebo piješ alkohol, existuje šance, že si vytvoříš závislost. Každá získaná závislost uděluje postih (postihy jsou různé dle dané chemikálie).
Požití látky, na kterou máš závislost, tento postih dočasně odstraní. Aby se ho však bylo možno zbavit nastálo, budeš muset navštívit doktora nebo použít lék Denarkol.

String.Source: Quickly teleport in a direction to sprint. Sprinting consumes Action Points.
String.Dest: Quickly teleport in a direction to sprint. Sprinting consumes Action Points.

String.Source: Bring the gun up to eye level to aim.
String.Dest: Bring the gun up to eye level to aim.

String.Source:
With a melee weapon equipped, bring it up in a defensive stance to block an incoming melee attack. Successfully blocked attacks do reduced damage and have a chance to cause your opponent to briefly stagger.
Projectiles cannot be blocked.
String.Dest:
Pokud držíš chladnou zbraň, zdvihni ji v obranném postavení pro blokování příchozího útoku zblízka. Úspěšně blokovaný útok působí menší poškození a má šanci na chvíli vyvést nepřítele z rovnováhy.
Projektily nemohou být blokovány.

String.Source:
Access terminals to uncover useful information, unlock secure doors, take control of linked turrets, bots, and spotlights, or play holotape games.
To enter a terminal, approach it and press [WTPad_Center].
Navigate between terminal entries by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. Select an entry with [WTrigger].
To exit a terminal or terminal page, press [WGrip].
Hacking Some terminals will be locked with a password. To hack a locked terminal, you must have the appropriate rank of the "Hacker" perk.
If you fail your hack, you will be locked out of the terminal and can attempt to hack it again after 10 seconds.
For more information, see the "Hacking" entry.
Holotape Games Some terminals can also play holotape games. To play a holotape game, enter the terminal and press [WTPad_Center].
This will bring up a list of all the holotape games currently in your inventory. Select the game you wish to play by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTrigger].
In a holotape game, move your character with [WTPad_Any]. To perform an action, press [WTrigger].
String.Dest:
Access terminals to uncover useful information, unlock secure doors, take control of linked turrets, bots, and spotlights, or play holotape games.
To enter a terminal, approach it and press [WTPad_Center].
Navigate between terminal entries by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. Select an entry with [WTrigger].
To exit a terminal or terminal page, press [WGrip].
Hacking Some terminals will be locked with a password. To hack a locked terminal, you must have the appropriate rank of the "Hacker" perk.
If you fail your hack, you will be locked out of the terminal and can attempt to hack it again after 10 seconds.
For more information, see the "Hacking" entry.
Holotape Games Some terminals can also play holotape games. To play a holotape game, enter the terminal and press [WTPad_Center].
This will bring up a list of all the holotape games currently in your inventory. Select the game you wish to play by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTrigger].
In a holotape game, move your character with [WTPad_Any]. To perform an action, press [WTrigger].

String.Source:
The Commonwealth has a variety of containers to discover and loot. Some containers may be locked, requiring a bobby pin, key, or terminal to access.
For more information about opening locked containers, visit the "Lockpicking" entry.
All containers have both a Quick menu and a Transfer menu.
Quick Menu Approach a container to display its Quick menu, which lists all items inside the targeted container.
Use [RWTPad_Up] and [RWTPad_Down] to scan through and select items. To take an item from the container, select it and press [RWTPad_Center].
To exit the Quick menu, simply look away.
Transfer Menu The Transfer menu provides a more in-depth view of your own inventory and the container's.
To access the Transfer menu, approach a container and press [WTPad_Up]. Your inventory will be displayed on the left and the container's on the right. To select your inventory, swipe [WTPad_Left]. To select the container's inventory, swipe [WTPad_Right].
To move an item from one inventory to another, highlight the item you wish to move with [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger]. To transfer all items from the container into your own inventory, press [WTPad_Center] and select LOOT ALL.
Press [WGrip] to exit the Transfer menu.
You can filter both your inventory or the container's by item type by pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting SORT.
Owned Containers Owned containers display their contents in red text, and their "Take" prompt is replaced with "Steal."
If you are observed stealing an owned item, its owner will approach and attempt to take the item back. If you try to flee or fight back, or if you're caught stealing again, they become hostile to you.
WARNING! Do not leave items in containers you do not own. They may not be there when you come back. If you want a place to store items permanently, consider buying a house or earning a room in a settlement.
String.Dest:

String.Source: Press [LWGrip] to sneak. While hidden, you do increased damage.
String.Dest: Press [LWGrip] to sneak. While hidden, you do increased damage.

String.Source:
IN TELEPORT MODE Press [LWTrigger] in rapid succession to Sprint.
Sprinting consumes Action Points (AP). Run out of AP, and you'll be unable to sprint.
You can slow the rate at which sprinting drains your AP by increasing your Endurance attribute.
IN DIRECT MOVEMENT MODE Press [LWTPad_Up] to Sprint.
String.Dest:
IN TELEPORT MODE Press [LWTrigger] in rapid succession to Sprint.
Sprinting consumes Action Points (AP). Run out of AP, and you'll be unable to sprint.
You can slow the rate at which sprinting drains your AP by increasing your Endurance attribute.
IN DIRECT MOVEMENT MODE Press [LWTPad_Up] to Sprint.

String.Source:
Press [RWTrigger] to fire a gun or ranged weapon. Swing your melee weapon to attack.
Gun Combat With a gun equipped, bring it up to eye level to aim. This will increase accuracy and trigger certain unlocked Perks.
Swing your gun at an enemy to perform a bash attack. You can increase the effectiveness of your weapon bashes by adding a bayonet mod to your gun.
Melee Combat While wielding a melee weapon, raise it up in a defensive stance to attempt to block an incoming melee strike. Successful blocks reduce the amount of incoming damage and have a chance to cause your opponent to briefly stagger.
Hold [RWTrigger] while swinging to perform a Power Attack. Performing a Power Attack consumes Action Points, but successful Power Attacks deal extra damage and cause an enemy to stagger. Power Attacks with heavy melee weapons can even break through an enemy's block.
Holstering Your Weapon Traveling with your drawn weapon can adversely affect your movement speed. The heavier your weapon, the slower you'll move. Hold [RWTPad_Center] to holster your weapon and restore your speed.
To draw your weapon again, press [RWTrigger].
String.Dest:
Stiskni [RWTrigger] pro útok střelnou zbraní nebo zbraní na dálku. Pro útok chladnou zbraní máchni rukou.
Boj střelnou zbraní Držíš-li zbraň, zvedni na úroveň očí pro zamíření. To zvýší přesnost a aktivuje určité získané perky.
Pro provedení útoku zblízka střelnou zbraní máchni rukou. Efektivitu útoku můžeš zvýšit přidáním modifikace bajonet.
Boj zblízka Držíš-li chladnou zbraň, zdvihni ji v obranném postoji pro pokus blokovat příchozí útok zblízka. Úspěšný blok snižuje příchozí poškození a má šanci krátce vyvést nepřítele z rovnováhy.
Podrž [RWTrigger] při máchnutí pro provedení silného útoku. Silný útok spotřebovává akční Body, ale úspěšný silný útok způsobuje vyšší poškození a vyvede nepřítele z rovnováhy. Silné útoky těžkou zbraní mohou dokonce prolomit blok nepřátel.
Odkládání zbraně Cestování s vytaženou zbraní může nepříznivě ovlivnit rychlost pohybu. Čím těžší zbraň držíš, tím pomaleji se pohybuješ. Přidrž [RWTPad_Center] pro uložení zbraně do pouzdra a obnovení rychlosti.
Pro opětovné tasení zbraně stiskni [RWTrigger].

String.Source:
During combat, your arms, legs, head, and torso will often become damaged. If they take too much damage, they'll become crippled.
Crippled limbs inflict the following penalties:
- Arms - it will be harder to aim your weapon - Legs - you will move at a reduced speed - Head - your hearing will become distorted
Once a limb has become crippled, it will remain so until treated. To treat a crippled limb, use a Stimpak. This will restore health to all your damaged limbs. You can also visit a doctor to heal your limbs for a fee or heal your limbs by sleeping.
To view the current condition of your limbs, open the Pip-Boy Stat tab and visit the Status section. The Vault Boy in the center of the screen will display any currently crippled limbs. The small bars surrounding the Vault Boy represent each of your limb's current health.
Crippling Enemies You can also cripple enemy limbs during combat. Press [RWMenu] while wielding a gun to specifically target enemy limbs using V.A.T.S. Check out the "V.A.T.S." entry for more information.
In addition to standard limbs, certain enemies have Combat Inhibitors. Cripple these and the enemy will be driven into a frenzy, attacking anyone nearby.
String.Dest:

String.Source: Lower the Pip-Boy, or press [WGrip] if using the Projected Pip-Boy, to exit the menu.
String.Dest: Lower the Pip-Boy, or press [WGrip] if using the Projected Pip-Boy, to exit the menu.

String.Source: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.
String.Dest: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.

String.Source: To jetpack, press and hold [LWGrip] while in the air. Jetpack use consumes your Fusion Core's charge.
String.Dest: To jetpack, press and hold [LWGrip] while in the air. Jetpack use consumes your Fusion Core's charge.

String.Source: To load ammo into your Syringer, equip it and press [RWGrip].
String.Dest: To load ammo into your Syringer, equip it and press [RWGrip].

String.Source: Look around to view your surroundings.
String.Dest: Look around to view your surroundings.

String.Source:
Dogmeat is a special companion who can accompany you as you travel across the Commonwealth.
Like other companions, Dogmeat can aid in combat, carry equipment, and accept commands, but unlike other companions, his opinion of you will not be affected by your actions or decisions. Dogmeat will stick by your side until you dismiss him.
You may only have one companion at any given time.
Combat While Dogmeat cannot use weapons, during combat he will attempt to grapple enemies, holding them in place and making them easier to target. Certain perks provide bonuses when you target grappled enemies.
Companion Menu With a few exceptions, Dogmeat functions just like a standard companion. You can trade items with him, equip him with certain cosmetic gear (bandanas, collars, etc.), and issue commands to him.
For more info on how standard companions work, see the "Companions" entry.
Where Dogmeat differs, however, is the "Talk - [WTPad_Up]" menu. From this menu you can:
- [WTPad_Up] - command Dogmeat to search the area for items - [WTPad_Down] - have Dogmeat perform a trick - [WTPad_Left] - dismiss Dogmeat
When you dismiss Dogmeat, you can tell him to wait for you at any friendly workshop. Otherwise, he'll return to his most recent residence.
String.Dest:

String.Source:
Stay alive longer by wearing Armor. Armor provides Damage Resistance, which reduces the damage you'll suffer from incoming attacks. You can purchase armor from merchants or loot it from your fallen foes.
Equipping Armor To equip a piece of armor, bring up the Pip-Boy and swipe [LWTPad_Left]/[LWTPad_Right] to open the Inventory (INV) tab. Then navigate to the Apparel section with [LWTPad_Left]/[LWTPad_Right].
Select the piece of armor you'd like to equip with [LWTPad_Up] and [LWTPad_Down] and press [LWTPad_Center]. Equipped armor, along with the armor's Damage Resistance, will be displayed on the Vault Boy on the right side of the screen.
Most armor is broken into pieces: a piece for each limb, a helmet, a torso, and a clothing item under the armor itself, which can provide additional Damage Resistance or stat bonuses.
Damage Resistance Armor provides one or more types of Damage Resistance. The higher your armor's damage resistance, the less damage you'll take from a given damage type.
There are four types of Damage Resistance:
- Ballistic - Energy (includes laser, plasma, flame and frost damage) - Radiation - Poison
You can see the protection provided by a given piece of armor by selecting it in the Apparel section of the Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab. The armor's Damage Resistances will be displayed on the right side of the screen. The total resistances provided by your current armor are displayed at the bottom of the screen.
If any of the currently selected armor's resistances are superior to those of your equipped armor, one or more "+" symbols will appear next to the superior resistance. If the selected piece's resistances are worse, one or more "-" symbols will appear.
To toggle which Damage Resistance type is displayed on the Vault Boy, hold [LWTPad_Center] and select SORT.
Sneaking and Armor Your armor's weight affects your ability to sneak. The heavier your armor, the more likely you are to be heard while sneaking.
Mods Armor is highly moddable. Visit an Armor Workbench to see what mods can be added to your armor.
For more information on building mods, see the "Mods" entry.
String.Dest:
Přežij déle díky nasazené zbroji. Zbroj poskytuje odolnost vůči zraněním, způsobeným příchozími útoky. Zbroje můžeš zakoupit u obchodníků nebo sebrat z padlých nepřátel.
Nasazení zbroje Pro nasazení části zbroje se podívej do Pip-Boye a přesunutím prstu [LWTPad_Left]/[LWTPad_Right] otevři záložku Inventář (INV). Poté vyhledej sekci Výstroj pomocí [LWTPad_Left]/[LWTPad_Right].
Vyber část zbroje, kterou si chceš nasadit pomocí [LWTPad_Up] a [LWTPad_Down] a volbu potvrď stiskem [LWTPad_Center]. Nasazená zbroj spolu se svojí odolností vůči zranění bude zobrazena ve Vault Boyovi na pravé straně obrazovky.
Většina zbrojí je rozdělena na jednotlivé části: část pro každou končetinu, helma, hruď a obyčejné oblečení pod samotnou zbroj, které může poskytnout dodatečnou odolnost vůči zranění nebo bonusy ke statistikám.
Odolnost vůči zranění Zbroj poskytuje jeden nebo více typů odolnosti vůči zranění. Čím vyšší je odolnost vůči zranění, tím méně zranění utrpíš z daného typu poškození.
Existují čtyři druhy odolnosti vůči zranění:
- Balistické - Energetické (zahrnuje laser, plazmu, oheň a zranění mrazem) - Radiace - Jed
Můžeš si prohlédnout ochranu poskytovanou jednotlivou částí zbroje tím, že ji označíš v sekci Výstroj v Pip-Boyovi v záložce Inventář (INV). Odolnost vůči zranění bude zobrazená na pravé straně obrazovky. Celkové odolnosti, poskytované veškerou momentálně nošenou zbrojí, jsou zobrazeny na spodní straně obrazovky.
Jestliže má momentálně vybraná zbroj lepší statistiky než ta, kterou právě nosíš, objeví se vedle hodnoty momentálně vybrané zbroje jedno nebo více znamének „+“. Statistiky, které jsou horší než u nošené zbroje, budou mít vedle svých hodnot jedno nebo více znamének „-“.
Pro přepínání mezi typy odolností, zobrazenými na Vault Boyovi podrž [LWTPad_Center] a zvol SEŘADIT.
Plížení a zbroj Váha zbroje ovlivňuje tvou schopnost plížení. Čím je tvá zbroj těžší, tím je pravděpodobnější, že tě při plížení odhalí.
Modifikace Zbroj je velmi modifikovatelná. V ponku na úpravu zbroje zjisti, které modifikace můžeš přidat ke své zbroji.
Pro více informací ohledně tvorby modifikací se podívej do záznamu „Modifikace“.

String.Source:
Press [LWGrip] to sneak. Sneaking allows you to avoid detection by enemies.
While sneaking, your current level of detection will be displayed on screen. There are four levels of detection:
Hidden No nearby characters detect you. While hidden, any attacks you make are considered "Sneak Attacks" and deal increased damage, but attacking risks exposing your position.
The brackets around the word "HIDDEN" indicate how close you are to being detected. The further apart the brackets, the more successful your sneaking.
Detected Non-hostile characters nearby have been alerted to your presence.
Caution Enemies have detected you and are actively searching for you. If you can evade them for long enough, they will return to their previous activity.
The further apart the brackets around "CAUTION", the closer you are to returning to "HIDDEN."
Attacks made while in Caution still count at Sneak Attacks.
Danger Enemies have spotted you and will begin attacking.
Successful sneaking is affected by a number of factors:
Light Level The darker the spot you're sneaking in, the harder it will be for enemies to spot you. If you're close to being detected, try ducking into the shadows to remain hidden.
Line of Sight If enemies don't have line of sight to you, they're much less likely to detect you.
Movement You're hardest to detect while motionless and easier to spot while moving. It's significantly harder to sneak while moving quickly (although this can be improved with perks).
Sound Attacking with unsilenced or heavy weapons makes noise, which may alert enemies to your presence.
Armor The higher the weight of your armor, the more noise it makes while moving. Sneaking is extremely challenging in Power Armor.
Enemies will also react to loud noises in the environment. If you can trigger an explosion or trap without being detected, you can lure away unsuspecting enemies.
String.Dest:

String.Source:
While wielding a gun, bring it up to eye level to aim.
Aiming gives you more precise control over your gun. It increases accuracy, slows movement, and depending on the sight, can grant a slight zoom towards your target.
Guns with a scope provide a magnified zoom. To steady the aim of your scope, hold [RWGrip] to hold your breath. Holding your breath steadies your scope, but will drain your Action Points as you use it.
A variety of gun mods can affect your ability to aim.
- Long barrels can increase accuracy - Reflex sights added to a scope make aiming faster - Heavier mods will increase the time to aim - Scopes improve magnification
For more information about mods, see the "Mods" entry.
String.Dest:
Pokud máš v ruce střelnou zbraň, zdvihni ji pro míření do úrovni očí.
Míření ti poskytuje lepší kontrolu nad zbraní. Zvyšuje přesnost, snižuje rychlost pohybu a v závislosti na mířidle může poskytnout menší přiblížení cíle.
Zbraně s optikou poskytují větší přiblížení. Pro ustálení míření s optikou přidrž [RWGrip] k zadržení dechu. Zadržení dechu vyrovná tvojí optiku, ale průběžně spotřebovává akční Body.
Různé druhy modifikací střelných zbraní mohou ovlivnit tvé míření:
- Dlouhé hlavně mohou zvýšit tvou přesnost - Reflexní mířidla, přidaná k optice, urychlují míření - Těžší modifikace zvýšují čas potřebný pro míření - Optika zlepšuje přiblížení
Pro více informací o modifikacích otevři záznam „Modifikace“.

String.Source:
While you can use the workshop to simply modify the environment, you can also turn your workshops into thriving settlements.
The Workshop menu (Press and hold [RWTPad_Center]) summarizes the current state of your workshop settlement:
People This indicates how many people live at your settlement. Some workshops will already have settlers when you arrive. For others, you'll need to attract new settlers. Check out "Attracting New Settlers" below for details.
Food This number indicates how much food your settlement if producing on a daily basis. If this is red, it indicates that lack of food is making your settlers unhappy.
Water Your settlement's current daily water production. If this is red, it indicates that lack of water is making your settlers unhappy.
Power The current total power production of your settlement. If this is red, it indicates that you have less total power than is required by all the powered objects in this area.
Defense Your settlement's current defense value. Red indicates that there is a higher chance for attacks on your settlement.
Beds The number of beds your settlement has available. Red indicates there are fewer beds than settlers, which makes your settlers unhappy.
Happiness Your settlement's overall Happiness rating. Higher happiness means higher productivity for all resources produced by your settlers.
For more in-depth information on Happiness, see the "Workshop - Happiness" entry.
Attracting New Settlers To attract new people to your settlements, build a Recruitment Radio Beacon (Power > Miscellaneous).
While you have one of these beacons active at a workshop location, there's a chance each day for new settlers to come live at your workshop.
Resource Production Each day, your workshop produces resources; your settlers also consume resources in order to survive. If there is a surplus, that resource will accumulate in the workshop's inventory. If there is a shortage, your settlers will become unhappy.
All the following resources will be placed into your workshop's inventory:
- Surplus food and water production
- Scavenging production from Scavenging Stations and otherwise unassigned settlers
- Income from stores
Moving Settlers Between Workshop Settlements You can move any friendly settler between your workshop settlements.
To move a settler, highlight them and press [RWTPad_Left] to display a list of your workshop settlements. Select the new settlement and the settler will travel to the selected location and live there.
Supply Lines Once you've acquired the "Local Leader" perk, you can create Supply Lines between your workshops.
To create a supply line, highlight a settler in one of your settlements and hold [RWTPad_Center] to display a list of workshop settlements. Select the settlement you want to link to your current settlement.
The settler will now be assigned to "supply line" duty and will travel between the settlements. (If you ever want to remove the supply line, simply assign the settler to some other work object.)
Linking your settlements with supply lines provides the following benefits:
- When building at a workshop, you can use the inventory of all linked workshops.
- Linked workshops can share resources. This means if you have a surplus of food at one settlement, you can link it to a settlement with a food shortage.

String.Source: Hold [RWTrigger] to charge your Gauss Rifle. Fully charged shots do maximum damage.
String.Dest: Hold [RWTrigger] to charge your Gauss Rifle. Fully charged shots do maximum damage.

String.Source:
Perks are special abilities that can affect everything from the damage you deal in combat, to your ability to persuade others, to new and questionably moral methods of healing yourself.
Each time you gain a level, you'll be granted a perk. You can select your new perk immediately by visiting the Perk chart or save it for later.
To enter the Perk chart, bring up the Pip-Boy, navigate to the Status screen, and press [WTrigger].
Perk Requirements Your current level and your SPECIAL attributes determine what perks you can take. If your SPECIAL attribute is too low for a given perk, you can increase it permanently by selecting one of the "Training" perks.
Note that temporary stat boosts from chems, food, or clothing do not count towards fulfilling perk requirements.
Perk Chart Swipe [WTPad_Any] to move between perks. Press [WTrigger] to select a perk.
Many perks have multiple ranks, providing new or more effective abilities. To see what abilities a perk provides at higher ranks, select the perk and press [WTPad_Right]. To return to earlier ranks, press [WTPad_Left].
To exit the Perk chart, press [WGrip].
String.Dest:

To exit the Perk chart, press [WGrip].

String.Source:
Any radio station broadcasting in your current area will be displayed on the Radio tab in the Pip-Boy. To listen in, swipe[WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] to select a station and press [WTrigger].
While a station is active, you can enter or exit the Pip-Boy and your selected station will continue to play.
String.Dest:
Any radio station broadcasting in your current area will be displayed on the Radio tab in the Pip-Boy. To listen in, swipe[WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] to select a station and press [WTrigger].
While a station is active, you can enter or exit the Pip-Boy and your selected station will continue to play.

String.Source: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.
String.Dest: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.

String.Source: Hold [LWTrigger] and hold the wand steady to initiate a jump down. Release [LWTrigger] to execute the jump.
String.Dest: Podrž [LWTrigger] a nehýbej ovladačem pro přípravu na skoku dolů. Uvolni [LWTrigger] pro provedení seskoku.

String.Source: Highlight a facial feature to sculpt using [RWTPad_Center].
String.Dest: Highlight a facial feature to sculpt using [RWTPad_Center].

String.Source: Laser Muskets can be charged by pressing [RWGrip] repeatedly. The more charges, the higher the damage.
String.Dest: Laser Muskets can be charged by pressing [RWGrip] repeatedly. The more charges, the higher the damage.

String.Source:
Visit the Quests section of the Pip-Boy Data tab to view all your currently active, available, and completed quests.
Select a quest in the Quests section by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger] to mark it as active. When a quest is active, a quest target for its current objective will appear on your compass and World Map.
Selecting a quest in the Quests section, press [WTPad_Center], and selecting SHOW ON MAP, will display the location of the selected quest's current objective on your map.
Any available miscellaneous (or "misc") quests will be displayed under the "Miscellaneous" entry.
To mark individual misc objectives as active, select the "Miscellanous" entry, press [WTPad_Center] and select NAVIGATE OBJECTIVES to select the specific objective you'd like to toggle and press [WTrigger].
String.Dest:
Visit the Quests section of the Pip-Boy Data tab to view all your currently active, available, and completed quests.
Select a quest in the Quests section by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger] to mark it as active. When a quest is active, a quest target for its current objective will appear on your compass and World Map.
Selecting a quest in the Quests section, press [WTPad_Center], and selecting SHOW ON MAP, will display the location of the selected quest's current objective on your map.
Any available miscellaneous (or "misc") quests will be displayed under the "Miscellaneous" entry.
To mark individual misc objectives as active, select the "Miscellanous" entry, press [WTPad_Center] and select NAVIGATE OBJECTIVES to select the specific objective you'd like to toggle and press [WTrigger].

String.Source:
You can purchase new goods and sell your spoils by bartering with merchants throughout the Commonwealth.
While bartering, your inventory is displayed on the left, while the merchant's goods are displayed on the right.
Use [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] to navigate between items in the merchant's inventory. Select items you'd like to purchase with [WTPad_Trigger].
To sell an item, swipe [WTPad_Left] to enter your inventory and select the item you wish to sell with [WTrigger]. Items you're offering for sale will appear at the top of the merchant's inventory. To return to the merchant's inventory, swipe [WTPad_Right].
You can also filter either inventory by item type by pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting SORT.
As you select items to purchase and offer items to sell, the net cost of the deal will appear at the bottom of the screen. Buy more than you're selling and the remaining caps will have to come from your own pocket.
Improving your Charisma will get you better prices from merchants, as will certain perks. Merchants only have a limited amount of caps to spend when purchasing items, though this pool will refresh over time.
To accept the offered deal, press [WTPad_Center] and select ACCEPT.
Press [WGrip] to exit the menu.
String.Dest:
Nakupovat nové zboží a prodávat svojí kořist můžeš u obchodníků po celém Commonwealthu.
Při obchodování je tvůj inventář zobrazen vlevo, zatímco obchodníkovo zboží je zobrazeno vpravo.
Pro navigaci mezi předměty v inventáři obchodníka požij [WTPad_Up] a [WTPad_Down]. Předměty k nákupu vyber pomocí [WTPad_Trigger].
Pro prodání předmětu přetáhnutím prstu [WTPad_Left] vstoupíš do svého inventáře a můžeš vybírat předměty pomocí [WTrigger]. Předměty, které nabízíš k prodeji, budou zobrazeny na vrchu inventáře obchodníka. Pro návrat do inventáře obchodníka přetáhni prstem [WTPad_Right].
Svůj i obchodníkův inventář můžeš filtrovat podle typu předmětu stisknutím [WTPad_Center] a volbou SEŘADIT.
Dle toho, jak si vybíráš věci ke koupi a své nabízíš k prodeji, zobrazuje se celková cena obchodu na spodní straně obrazovky. Kup za víc, než za kolik prodáváš, a zbylé zátky budou muset přijít z tvé vlastní kapsy.
Vylepšení charismatu a některé perky poskytují výhodnější ceny u obchodníků. Obchodníci mají pouze omezené množství zátek ke koupi věcí, které jim prodáváš, ale toto množství se časem obnovuje.
K přijmutí obchodu stiskni [WTPad_Center] a zvol PŘIJMOUT.
Stiskni [WGrip] Pro opuštění nabídky.

String.Source:
The amount of weight you can carry is determined by your Strength attribute. The higher your Strength, the more you can carry. You can increase this amount further by taking certain perks or wearing Power Armor.
Should you exceed this amount, however, you will be unable to run, sprint, or fast travel.
The fastest way to reduce the amount of weight you're carrying is by dropping items from your inventory.
To drop an item, bring up the the Pip-Boy and open the Inventory (INV) tab with [WTPad_Left]/[WTPad_Right]. Highlight the item you wish to drop by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTPad_Center] and select DROP.
Items you drop will remain for a time, but leave them too long and there's a good chance they'll be gone when you finally come back.
String.Dest:
Množství zátěže, kterou uneseš je určeno vlastností Síla. Čím vyšší je tvá síla, tím více toho uneseš. Tuto hodnotu můžeš dále zvýšit výběrem určitých perků nebo nošením energozbroje.
Pokud ovšem toho množství překročíš, nebudeš moci běžet, sprintovat, ani rychle cestovat.
Nejrychlejší způsob, jak se zbavit zátěže, kterou neseš, je zahození věcí z tvého inventáře.
Pro zahození předmětu se podívej do Pip-Boye a pomocí [WTPad_Left]/[WTPad_Right] otevři záložku Inventář (INV). Zvýrazni předmět, který si přeješ zahodit, stiskni [WTPad_Center] a zvol ZAHODIT.
Předměty, které zahodíš, po nějakou dobu zůstanou na místě, ale pokud je necháš ležet delší čas, je pravděpodobné, že zmizí, až se pro ně nakonec vrátíš.

String.Source:
Your Pip-Boy can be used to play any holotapes you discover.
When you find a holotape, you can play it immediately by looking at it and pressing [RWTPad_Left], or press [RWTPad_Center] to add it to your inventory.
To play a holotape you've picked up, bring up the Pip-Boy and head to the Misc section in the Inventory (INV) tab. Here you will see a list of all the holotapes you've collected.
Select a holotape by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] press [WTrigger] to play it. You can then exit the Pip-Boy and the holotape will continue to play. To stop a playing holotape, press [WTrigger].
Some holotapes also contain games which can be played at certain terminals or on your Pip-Boy. See the "Holotape Games" entry for more information.
String.Dest:

String.Source:
Press [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right] - Change tabs
Swipe [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right] - Change sections
Swipe [WTPad_Up] or [WTPad_Down] - Change selection
[WTPad_Center] - Selection options menu
[WTrigger] - Open Perk chart while on the status screen
[WGrip] - Exit while in projected Pip-Boy mode

String.Source: Choose a slot for your item on the Favorites menu with [WTPad_Any].
String.Dest: Choose a slot for your item on the Favorites menu with [WTPad_Any].

String.Source:
Power Armor suits can be found scattered across the Commonwealth, particularly in old military installations.
Intact Power Armor provides a significant reduction to incoming damage. However, unlike standard armor, Power Armor pieces can take damage and become unwearable, reducing overall protection.
Power Armor in any state will increase your melee damage, the amount of weight you can carry, prevent all damage from falling, and, with a helmet equipped, increase how long you can stay underwater.
To exit a suit of Power Armor, hold [RWTPad_Center].
Fusion Cores Power Armor runs on Fusion Cores. Performing any of the following actions will reduce your Power Armor core's charge:
- Running - Sprinting - Power Attacks - VATS
Once your Fusion Core has been emptied, you will move at a reduced rate and will be unable to Power Attack or use V.A.T.S.
If you have another Fusion Core in your inventory when your current core runs out, it will automatically be installed in your suit. Otherwise, you'll either need to find a new core to restore your Power Armor's functionality or abandon your suit.
New Fusion Cores can often be found in old generators throughout the Commonwealth or purchased from merchants.
Power Armor Pieces All Power Armor is made of two major components: a frame and a set of armor pieces.
Each armor piece attached to your frame increases your Damage Resistance, but a Power Armor frame does not require armor pieces to function. A frame without armor pieces will still provide protection against falling, increased melee damage, extra carry weight, and some Damage Resistance.
Armor pieces can become damaged over time. While in your Power Armor, the current state of your armor pieces is visible on the suit icon to the left of the screen. Pieces in red have taken significant damage and should be repaired. Empty sections mean a piece is either missing or destroyed and must be replaced.
You can also view an armor piece's current health by selecting it in the Apparel section of the Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab or at a Power Armor station.
To add or remove an armor piece from your frame, select it in Apparel section of the Pip-Boy Inventory tab.
You can also equip or unequip armor pieces at a Power Armor station or by approaching your Power Armor suit and pressing [RWTPad_Up] to open the Transfer menu.
See the "Containers" entry for more information on using the Transfer menu.
Repairing Power Armor You can repair damaged armor pieces at any Power Armor station. If you have the components necessary to repair a damaged armor piece, select the piece on the station Inventory page and press [WTPad_Right]. If you don't, select the piece and press [WTrigger] to see what components are required.
Power Armor Mods You can also add and remove mods from your Power Armor at a Power Armor station. Modding your armor can increase its Damage Resistance, change paint materials, improve core efficiency, or add bonus stats and effects.
See the "Mods" entry for more information.
Power Armor Map Marker If you abandon your Power Armor, a marker will automatically appear on your map displaying the location of your armor. This marker will only display for your most recent suit of Power Armor. Find a new suit, and you'll need to find the other the old fashioned way.
String.Dest:
Power Armor suits can be found scattered across the Commonwealth, particularly in old military installations.
Intact Power Armor provides a significant reduction to incoming damage. However, unlike standard armor, Power Armor pieces can take damage and become unwearable, reducing overall protection.
Power Armor in any state will increase your melee damage, the amount of weight you can carry, prevent all damage from falling, and, with a helmet equipped, increase how long you can stay underwater.
To exit a suit of Power Armor, hold [RWTPad_Center].
Fusion Cores Power Armor runs on Fusion Cores. Performing any of the following actions will reduce your Power Armor core's charge:
- Running - Sprinting - Power Attacks - VATS

If you have another Fusion Core in your inventory when your current core runs out, it will automatically be installed in your suit. Otherwise, you'll either need to find a new core to restore your Power Armor's functionality or abandon your suit.
New Fusion Cores can often be found in old generators throughout the Commonwealth or purchased from merchants.

Each armor piece attached to your frame increases your Damage Resistance, but a Power Armor frame does not require armor pieces to function. A frame without armor pieces will still provide protection against falling, increased melee damage, extra carry weight, and some Damage Resistance.
Armor pieces can become damaged over time. While in your Power Armor, the current state of your armor pieces is visible on the suit icon to the left of the screen. Pieces in red have taken significant damage and should be repaired. Empty sections mean a piece is either missing or destroyed and must be replaced.
You can also view an armor piece's current health by selecting it in the Apparel section of the Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab or at a Power Armor station.
To add or remove an armor piece from your frame, select it in Apparel section of the Pip-Boy Inventory tab.
You can also equip or unequip armor pieces at a Power Armor station or by approaching your Power Armor suit and pressing [RWTPad_Up] to open the Transfer menu.
See the "Containers" entry for more information on using the Transfer menu.

If you have the components necessary to repair a damaged armor piece, select the piece on the station Inventory page and press [WTPad_Right]. If you don't, select the piece and press [WTrigger] to see what components are required.
Power Armor Mods You can also add and remove mods from your Power Armor at a Power Armor station. Modding your armor can increase its Damage Resistance, change paint materials, improve core efficiency, or add bonus stats and effects.

String.Source: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.
String.Dest: Select a favorited item with [RWTPad_Center]. Hilight and release on the item to use it.

String.Source:
MODDING STATIONS Workbenches and Power Armor stations allow you to build mods to improve your gear.
Building mods requires components, which are harvested from Junk Items. More advanced mods may require certain perks.
If you have the required components, select a mod and press [WTrigger] to craft it. The required items will be harvested automatically from your inventory (or from storage in this modding station).
If you're lacking components, select a mod and press [WTPad_Right] to tag it for search. Items containing components for that mod will now appear in the world with a magnifying glass next to their name.
String.Dest:
MODDING STATIONS Workbenches and Power Armor stations allow you to build mods to improve your gear.
Building mods requires components, which are harvested from Junk Items. More advanced mods may require certain perks.
If you have the required components, select a mod and press [WTrigger] to craft it. The required items will be harvested automatically from your inventory (or from storage in this modding station).
If you're lacking components, select a mod and press [WTPad_Right] to tag it for search. Items containing components for that mod will now appear in the world with a magnifying glass next to their name.

String.Source:
Some holotapes contain games that can be played at game-friendly terminals or via the Pip-Boy.
To play holotape games you've acquired on your Pip-Boy, bring up your Pip-Boy and navigate to the Misc section of the Inventory (INV) tab. Select the game you'd wish to play and press [WTrigger].
To play a game on a game-friendly terminal, enter the terminal with [WTPad_Center] and press [WTPad_Center] to bring up a list of all your available holotape games. Select the game you wish to play by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTrigger].
Once the game has loaded, press [WTrigger] to start playing.
To move in a holotape game, use [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right]. To perform an action, press [WTrigger].
Press [WGrip] to pause the game. Pausing the game also brings up the Quit menu. Select "Yes" and press [WTrigger] to quit.
String.Dest:
Some holotapes contain games that can be played at game-friendly terminals or via the Pip-Boy.
To play holotape games you've acquired on your Pip-Boy, bring up your Pip-Boy and navigate to the Misc section of the Inventory (INV) tab. Select the game you'd wish to play and press [WTrigger].
To play a game on a game-friendly terminal, enter the terminal with [WTPad_Center] and press [WTPad_Center] to bring up a list of all your available holotape games. Select the game you wish to play by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTrigger].
Once the game has loaded, press [WTrigger] to start playing.
To move in a holotape game, use [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right]. To perform an action, press [WTrigger].
Press [WGrip] to pause the game. Pausing the game also brings up the Quit menu. Select "Yes" and press [WTrigger] to quit.

String.Source:
Workshops allow you to mold the environment around them: building new objects and structures, adjusting the location and orientation of existing ones, or scrapping items you don't want.
Once you've gained access to a workshop, press and hold [LWMenu] to enter the Workshop menu when you are anywhere in that workshop's "Build Area."
Navigate the Workshop menu by swiping [LWTPad_Left] and [LWTPad_Right].
Building an Object In order to build a new object, select the category of item you'd like to build by swiping [LWTPad_Left] and [LWTPad_Right], then press [LWTPad_Up] until the object you want to build appears in the center of the menu.
When the object is highlighted in green, you can build it. When it's highlighted in red, you need to move it somewhere else in order to build it; it may be intersecting with another object or be floating in mid-air. Some objects also have special rules for placement; for example, crops must be placed in dirt; water purifiers can only be built in water.
Workshop items are built from components, which can be harvested from Junk Items found throughout the Commonwealth. The components required to build a new object are displayed on screen. Items harvested to build the new object will be removed from the workshop's inventory if available, otherwise from your inventory.
Existing Objects Some objects in the world can also be manipulated using the Workshop menu. These objects fall into three categories:
- Inventory Objects - objects you can pick up and put into your inventory can also be moved around, stored, or scrapped using the Workshop menu.
- Buildable Objects - objects you can build using the Workshop menu can be moved around, stored, or scrapped using the Workshop menu.
- Scrappable Objects - some objects (for example, stumps, dead trees, rubble) can be scrapped using the Workshop menu, but not moved or stored.
To move an existing object, target it with the pointer and press [RWTrigger] to select it. Once selected, you can move the object around in the same way you would with a new object.
Press [RWTPad_Right] to store an object. Buildable objects can be rebuilt later for free; inventory items are placed in the workshop's inventory.
Press [RWTPad_Left] to scrap an object, breaking it back into components. You can see what components you will gain for scrapping by highlighting the object. These components will be placed directly into the workshop's inventory when the object is scrapped.
Object Manipulation You can use the following controls to move around new or existing objects:
- Swipe [RWTPad_Left] and [RWTPad_Right] to rotate the selected object horizontally
- Swipe [RWTPad_Up] and [RWTPad_Down] to move the object closer or farther away
- Raise or lower the pointer to move the object vertically
- [RWTrigger] places the object in its new location. [RWGrip] cancels - restoring an existing object to its original position, or canceling building a new object.

String.Source:
Cook up homemade chems at a Chemistry Station. Chems can provide a variety of stat bonuses and beneficial effects, even restore lost health, but use them too frequently and you risk addiction.
Crafting chems requires ingredients which can be purchased or found throughout the world.
You can navigate between chem recipes or categories with [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. To select a category or a recipe to craft, press [WTrigger].
Recipes Select a category to enter the Recipes menu.
If you have the ingredients required for a recipe in your inventory or in storage at the station, select the recipe and press [WTrigger]. This will consume the ingredients and craft your chem.
If you lack the ingredients necessary to prepare a specific chem, press [WTPad_Right] to tag it for search.
Tagged ingredients will appear in the world with a small magnifying glass next to their name when approached.
Storage You can also store ingredients in a chemistry station by approaching the bench and pressing [WTPad_Up] to open the station's Transfer menu. When crafting a chem, ingredients stored in the chemistry station will be used before those in your inventory.
For more info on how to use the Transfer menu, check out the "Containers" entry.
String.Dest:
Uvař si po domácku vyrobené drogy v chemické laboratoři. Drogy mohou poskytnout řadu bonusů a prospěšných účinků, nebo dokonce obnovit ztracené zdraví, ale příliš časté užívání tě vystavuje riziku závislosti.
Výroba drog vyžaduje přísady, které mohou být zakoupeny nebo nalezeny po celém světě.
Vybírat mezi recepty nebo kategoriemi receptů můžeš pomocí [WTPad_Up] a [WTPad_Down]. Pro výběr receptu nebo kategorie receptů k výrobě stiskni [WTrigger].
Recepty Vyber kategorii pro vstup do nabídky Receptů.
Pokud máš přísady potřebné pro recept ve svém inventáři nebo skladem ve stanici, vyber recept stiskni [WTrigger]. Toto spotřebuje přísady a vyrobí tvou drogu.
Pokud postrádáš nezbytné přísady pro přípravu konkrétního receptu, stiskni [WTPad_Right] k označení pro vyhledávání.
Označené přísady budou mít ve světě vedle svého názvu zobrazenou malou lupu.
Skladování Můžeš také skladovat přísady v chemické laboratoři přistoupením ke stanici a stisknutím [WTPad_Up] pro otevření nabídky pro přesun stanice. Při výrobě chemikálie budou prioritně spotřebovány přísady, skladované v chemické laboratoři, teprve poté předměty ve tvém inventáři.
Pro více informací o používání Nabídky pro přesun si prohlédni záznam „Úložné prostory“.

String.Source: To issue a command, target a location, object, or enemy and press [RWTPad_Center].
String.Dest: To issue a command, target a location, object, or enemy and press [RWTPad_Center].

String.Source:
As you explore the world, your compass can be a valuable source of information.
Along with the current direction you're heading, any undiscovered locations of interest will appear on your compass in outline. The closer you get to a location, the larger its icon will become. Once you've discovered a location, its icon will fill.
Nearby enemies are also displayed on the compass. How far away an enemy can be before appearing on your compass is determined by your Perception attribute. The better your Perception, the further away you'll be able to spot enemies.
Detected enemies will appear as red squares on the compass. If the enemy is above or below you, an arrow will appear on their square to indicate their direction.
Quest targets for your active quests will appear on your compass as green squares. Like enemies, if your target is above or below you, an arrow will appear on the square to indicate its direction.
String.Dest:

Along with the current direction you're heading, any undiscovered locations of interest will appear on your compass in outline. The closer you get to a location, the larger its icon will become. Once you've discovered a location, its icon will fill.

Quest targets for your active quests will appear on your compass as green squares. Like enemies, if your target is above or below you, an arrow will appear on the square to indicate its direction.

String.Source:
The Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab contains information on all the items you're currently carrying, as well as your gear's total weight and the number of caps you've acquired.
Inventory Controls To equip or use an item, select it by swiping [WTPad_Up] or [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger].
To drop an item from your inventory, select it and press [WTPad_Center] then select DROP.
To add an item to the favorites menu, select it and press [WTPad_Center] and select FAV. Then select the slot you would like to add it to using [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right].
Items in your inventory are sorted alphabetically by default. To change how they are sorted, press [WTPad_Center] and select SORT. You can sort by item damage/damage resistance, weight, or value.
To take a closer look at an item in your inventory, press [WTPad_Center] and select INSPECT.
Weapons The Weapons section contains information on all guns, melee weapons, and explosives in your inventory.
The stats for the currently selected weapon are displayed on the right side of the screen.
If the currently selected weapon has better stats than the one you have equipped, one or more "+" symbols will appear next to the selected weapon's superior stat. Stats that are worse than your equipped weapon's will have one or more "-" symbols next to them.
Apparel The Apparel section provides info on any armor or clothing you've collected.
If you have a piece of armor or clothing equipped, it will be displayed on the Vault Boy on the right side of the screen, as will that item's Damage Resistance.
You can cycle which resistance type is displayed by pressing [LWTPad_Center] and selecting SORT.
The stats of the currently selected item are listed below the Vault Boy. Like in the Weapons section, items with stats superior to your equipped gear's will display with one or more "+" symbols. Worse stats will appear with "-" symbols.
Your current total Damage Resistances are displayed at the bottom of the screen.
Aid The Aid section lists all medicine, chems, and food in your inventory. The stats and bonuses provided by the currently selected item are displayed on the right.
A small clock icon next to an item's effect means the effect is only temporary.
Misc The Misc section contains a variety of items, including holotapes, keys, notes, and bobby pins.
To listen to a holotape, select it and press [LWTrigger]. You can then exit the Pip-Boy and the holotape will continue to play. To stop a playing holotape, select it again and press [WTrigger].
To play any holotape games you've acquired, simply select the tape you'd like to play and press [WTrigger]. See the "Holotape Games" entry for more information.
Junk The Junk section lists any items that can be harvested for components at modding stations or at a workshop. (See the "Components" entry for more info.)
By pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting COMPONENT VIEW while in the Junk section, you can enter Component View, which lists all the components you could harvest from the Junk Items currently in your inventory.
In this view, you can tag specific components for search by selecting them and pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting TAG FOR SEARCH. Once a component is tagged, items containing tagged components will have a small magnifying glass next to their name when approached.
Mods Any mods that you've purchased or built that are not currently attached to an item are listed in the Mods section.
Ammo The Ammo section displays all the ammunition currently in your inventory.
String.Dest:

String.Source: Swing at an enemy with fists or an equipped weapon to melee attack.
String.Dest: Swing at an enemy with fists or an equipped weapon to melee attack.

String.Source:
Enter a friendly Vertibird by pressing [WTPad_Center]. Fire the Vertbird's mini-gun by pressing [RWTrigger].
Once you've gained enough clout with certain groups in the Commonwealth, you can call in a Vertibird to transport you to any exterior location you've previously visited.
Calling in a Vertibird requires Vertibird signal grenades. You can equip signal grenades you've acquired through your inventory, then hold [RWGrip] to toss them.
Once inside your Vertibird, bring up the Pip-Boy. Open the Map tab and select the location you'd like to travel to with [WTrigger].
When calling in a Vertibird, be sure to throw your signal grenade in a spot where the vehicle has plenty of space to land. You cannot call for Vertibirds while indoors.
A called-in Vertibird can be ordered to land by pressing [LWGrip] or you can hop out by pressing [WTPad_Center].
String.Dest:
Enter a friendly Vertibird by pressing [WTPad_Center]. Fire the Vertbird's mini-gun by pressing [RWTrigger].
Once you've gained enough clout with certain groups in the Commonwealth, you can call in a Vertibird to transport you to any exterior location you've previously visited.
Calling in a Vertibird requires Vertibird signal grenades. You can equip signal grenades you've acquired through your inventory, then hold [RWGrip] to toss them.
Once inside your Vertibird, bring up the Pip-Boy. Open the Map tab and select the location you'd like to travel to with [WTrigger].
When calling in a Vertibird, be sure to throw your signal grenade in a spot where the vehicle has plenty of space to land. You cannot call for Vertibirds while indoors.
A called-in Vertibird can be ordered to land by pressing [LWGrip] or you can hop out by pressing [WTPad_Center].

String.Source: Hold and release [RWGrip] to throw grenades or place mines.
String.Dest: Hold and release [RWGrip] to throw grenades or place mines.

String.Source: Point your gun at an enemy to target specific limbs. Melee weapons cannot target limbs.
String.Dest: Point your gun at an enemy to target specific limbs. Melee weapons cannot target limbs.

String.Source: Open the Map tab and select a destination for the Vertibird with [WTrigger].
String.Dest: Open the Map tab and select a destination for the Vertibird with [WTrigger].

String.Source:
Many workshop objects require Power to function. To provide Power to an object, you'll need to hook it up to an existing generator or build a new one from the Workshop menu (Resources > Power > Generators).
Power is shared between most objects by wires. You can run a wire between two objects by highlighting one of the objects and pressing [RWTPad_Up].
Objects that are within range of the wire will be highlighted in white. Highlight one of them and press [RWTPad_Center] again and the two objects will now be connected by a wire.
All objects that are connected together by wires are considered a "power grid," and can use all Power produced within the connected grid. This means you can hook up multiple generators into a power grid in order to provide Power to everything on the grid.
The direction of the wires doesn't matter; Power can flow freely around the grid as long as there is some wired connection between the generator and the object that needs Power.
Highlighting a generator will also highlight all objects that are part of its power grid. Highlighting an object that requires Power will also show if it is currently powered; if the "Requires Power" icon is red, then the object isn't currently receiving Power.
This means that either the object isn't hooked up to a power source at all, or that the power grid that it is attached to is overloaded; there isn't enough power on the grid to supply all the objects that need it.
Wires have a limited range; if you need to run wires a long distance, use power connectors to bridge the gap (Resources > Power > Connectors & Switches). These include switched versions, which allow you to turn power on and off to anything connected to the switch.
Some objects, such as lightbulbs, receive Power simply from being near a power connector, like a Power Pylon, rather than using a direct wired connection.
String.Dest:

Wires have a limited range; if you need to run wires a long distance, use power connectors to bridge the gap (Resources > Power > Connectors & Switches). These include switched versions, which allow you to turn power on and off to anything connected to the switch.
Some objects, such as lightbulbs, receive Power simply from being near a power connector, like a Power Pylon, rather than using a direct wired connection.

String.Source:
You can quickly return to any location you've previously visited by fast traveling.
To fast travel, bring up the Pip-Boy and open the Map tab by pressing [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right]. Move the map crosshair to the location to which you'd like to travel, press [WTrigger], then select "Fast Travel."
You cannot fast travel while you are in combat, if you are carrying too much weight, or from most indoor locations.
String.Dest:
You can quickly return to any location you've previously visited by fast traveling.
To fast travel, bring up the Pip-Boy and open the Map tab by pressing [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right]. Move the map crosshair to the location to which you'd like to travel, press [WTrigger], then select "Fast Travel."
You cannot fast travel while you are in combat, if you are carrying too much weight, or from most indoor locations.

String.Source:
As you travel the Commonwealth, you'll have the opportunity to enlist Companions to help you on your journey. Companions can aid you in combat, haul gear, and if they like you enough, provide you with special perks.
You may only have one companion at any given time.
Companion Menu Approach your companion and press [WTPad_Center] to bring up their Companion menu. From this menu, you can:
- Talk - [WTPad_Up] - Chat with or dismiss your companion - Stay - [WTPad_Down] - Command your companion to stay put - Trade - [WTPad_Left] - Trade items or adjust your companion's gear
Trading and Equipping Select "Trade - [WTPad_Left]" to enter your companion's inventory. From here, you can transfer items between you and your companion.
To transfer an item, select it with [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger]. To enter your companion's inventory, swipe [WTPad_Right].
You can also specify the gear you'd like your companion to equip, though not all companions can equip all gear. To have your companion equip an item, add it to their inventory, select it, and hold [WTrigger].
To instantly move everything from your companion's inventory to your own, press [WTPad_Center] and select LOOT ALL.
Talking and Dismissing In the "Talk - [WTPad_Up]" menu, you can:
- [WTPad_Up] - Chat with your companion - [WTPad_Down] - Find out how your companion currently feels about you - [WTPad_Left] - Dismiss your companion
When you dismiss your companion, you can order them to wait for you at any friendly workshop. Otherwise, they'll return to their most recent residence.
Commands You can issue commands to your companion either from the Companion menu or by facing them from a distance and pressing [WTPad_Center].
This will put them in Command mode.
To issue a command, target the object or location you'd like your companion to approach and press [WTPad_Center]. Companions can be commanded to:
- Move to a specific location - Use objects in the world, like doors, buttons, or furniture - Collect items - Attack enemies
Certain companions can also be commanded to pick locks or hack terminals. A companion must have bobby pins in their inventory before they can pick locks.
Companions may refuse to perform certain actions, either because they are physically unable to, or because they have a moral objection to what you've requested. You will be held responsible for any crime your companion commits.
To stop issuing commands, press [RWGrip].
Relationship Like most folks in the Commonwealth, companions have feelings and values determined by their allegiances and upbringing.
If you make decisions or perform actions your companion likes, it will improve your relationship with them, and they'll be more likely to share information about themselves.
Get your companion to like you enough and they'll permanently grant you a unique perk.
Make enough decisions your companion dislikes, however, and they'll refuse to travel with you. Permanently.
String.Dest:
Na svých cestách po Commonwealthu budeš mít příležitost nabrat společníky, aby ti pomohli na tvé pouti. Společníci ti mohou pomáhat v boji, s přepravou vybavení, a pokud tě mají dostatečně rádi, mohou ti poskytnout i speciální perky.
Můžeš mít aktivního pouze jednoho společníka.
Nabídka společníka Přistup ke svému společníkovi a stiskni [WTPad_Center] pro zobrazení jeho nabídky. V nabídce máš na výběr:
- Promluvit - [WTPad_Up] - Mluvit s nebo propustit společníka - Zůstaň - [WTPad_Down] - Nařídit společníkovi, aby zůstal na místě - Obchodovat - [WTPad_Left] - Vyměňovat předměty nebo upravovat vybavení tvého společníka
Vybavení Zvol „Vybavení - [WTPad_Left]“ pro vstup do společníkova inventáře. V rámci něj si pak mezi sebou můžete vyměňovat předměty.
Pro přesun předmětu ho vyber pomocí [WTPad_Up] a [WTPad_Down], pak stiskni [WTrigger]. Pro přechod do inventáře společníka přesuň prst [WTPad_Right].
Můžeš také určit, jaké vybavení chceš, aby tvůj společník používal, ačkoliv ne všichni společníci mohou používat všechny předměty. Aby tvůj společník použil daný předmět, přidej ho do jeho inventáře, vyber ho a podrž [WTrigger].
Pro okamžitý přesun všech předmětů ze společníkova inventáře do tvého stiskni [WTPad_Center] a zvol VZÍT VŠE.
Rozhovor a Propuštění V nabídce „Promluvit - [WTPad_Up]“ můžeš:
- [WTPad_Up] - Promluvit si se společníkem - [WTPad_Down] - Zjistit, co si o tobě momentálně společník myslí - [WTPad_Left] - Propustit společníka
Když propustíš svého společníka, můžeš mu přikázat, aby na tebe počkal v libovolné přátelské dílně. Jinak se vrátí na místo, kde přebýval naposledy.
Příkazy Můžeš vydávat příkazy svému společníkovi z nabídky společníka nebo z dálky, když se k němu otočíš čelem a stiskneš [WTPad_Center].
Toto u společníka spustí příkazový režim.
Pro vydání příkazu, zaměř objekt nebo místo, kam chceš, aby se společník vydal a stiskni [WTPad_Center]. Společníkům může být přikázáno:
- Přesun na konkrétní místo - Používání objektů ve světě jako jsou dveře, tlačítka nebo nábytek - Sbírání předmětů - Útočení na nepřátele
Někteří společníci jsou také schopni otevírat zámky nebo hackovat terminály. Předtím, než se společník může pokusit o otevření zámku, musí mít u sebe vlásenku.
Společníci mohou odmítnout vykonat některé příkazy, protože toho nejsou buď fyzicky schopni nebo mají morální výhrady vůči tvému požadavku. Budeš nést zodpovědnost za jakýkoliv zločin, kterého se tvůj společník dopustí.
Pro ukončení vydávání příkazů, stiskni [RWGrip].
Vztahy Jako většina lidí v Commonwealthu, mají společníci pocity a hodnoty určené jejich příslušností a výchovou.
Pokud učiníš rozhodnutí nebo provedeš čin, který se tvému společníkovi líbí, zlepší to s ním tvůj vztah a bude více nakloněn sdílet s tebou osobní informace.
Když zařídíš, aby tě měl tvůj společník dostatečně rád, poskytne ti nastálo unikátní perk.
Učiň však dostatek rozhodnutí, se kterými tvůj společník nesouhlasí a odmítne s tebou cestovat. Natrvalo.

String.Source:
Head to the Data tab in the Pip-Boy to check out your active and available quests, the state of your workshop locations, and tons of stats on your time in the Commonwealth.
Quests All your currently active, available, and completed quests are listed in the Quests section.
To view the current objective for a quest, select it by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. It's current objective (as well as any already completed objectives) will appear on the right.
You can mark a selected quest as active by pressing [WTrigger]. Quest targets for all your active quests will appear on your compass and map.
To view the location of a quest's current objective on the map, press [WTPad_Center] and select SHOW ON MAP.
Press [WTPad_Center] and select SHOW SUMMARY to view the quest summary of your currently selected quest.
Miscellaneous Quests The Quests section also contains information about any miscellaneous quests you have available. Completing "misc" quests can often lead to new quests, locations, and loot.
To view misc quest objectives, select the "Miscellaneous" entry from your list of quests.
To mark individual misc objectives as active, select the "Miscellanous" entry by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down], then press [WTPad_Center] and select NAVIGATE OBJECTIVES to select the specific objective you'd like to toggle and press [LWTrigger].
You can also toggle all misc quests active or inactive by selecting the "Miscellanous" entry and pressing [WTrigger].
Workshops In the Workshops section, you can view the current stats for all your workshop locations.
Any workshops that require your attention will have a small hazard icon next to their name and next to the resources they're currently lacking.
Press [WTPad_Center] and select SHOW ON MAP to view the selected workshop location on the map.
Stats The Stats section contains a variety of different statistics on your time in the Commonwealth.

String.Source:
Speedily access items or gear by adding them to the Favorites menu.
To favorite an item, bring up the Pip-Boy. Select the item you'd like to favorite on the Inventory (INV) tab and hold [WTPad_Center] and select FAV. This will bring up the Favorites menu. Use [WTPad_Any] to select a slot for the item.
As you travel the world, you can then bring up the Favorites menu at any time by using [RWTPad_Center]. To then use an item, highlight it with [WTPad_Any] and release the touchpad.
To remove a favorited item, enter the Inventory tab, select the item you wish to remove, and press [WTPad_Center] and select FAV. Select the item on the Favorites menu with [WTPad_Any].
String.Dest:
Speedily access items or gear by adding them to the Favorites menu.
To favorite an item, bring up the Pip-Boy. Select the item you'd like to favorite on the Inventory (INV) tab and hold [WTPad_Center] and select FAV. This will bring up the Favorites menu. Use [WTPad_Any] to select a slot for the item.
As you travel the world, you can then bring up the Favorites menu at any time by using [RWTPad_Center]. To then use an item, highlight it with [WTPad_Any] and release the touchpad.
To remove a favorited item, enter the Inventory tab, select the item you wish to remove, and press [WTPad_Center] and select FAV. Select the item on the Favorites menu with [WTPad_Any].

String.Source:
To pickpocket, press [LWGrip] and approach your target. When you're within range, press [WTPad_Center] to look through their inventory.
Select an item in your target's inventory by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] to see your chance to successfully steal it. Press [WTrigger] to attempt to take it.
If you're feeling particularly bold, press [WTPad_Center] and select LOOT ALL to attempt to take everything they have on them.
If you are detected while attempting to pickpocket, your target and any witnesses will immediately become hostile to you.
Note that looking through your target's inventory is not a crime. You will only be attacked if you attempt to steal something and fail. You cannot pickpocket while in combat.
You can also use pickpocket to plant items on your target by selecting an item in your own inventory and pressing [WTrigger]. Once you've acquired certain perks, you can even plant live grenades or mines on your target, leading to explosive results.
Improve your chances to successfully pickpocket by increasing your Agility attribute or by taking certain perks.
String.Dest:
