String.Source: Move your head to look around.
String.Dest: Move your head to look around.

String.Source:
Action Points (AP) are a measurement of your physical energy. AP is used to:
- Sprint - Power Attack - Perform attacks and reload in V.A.T.S. - Steady your aim while using a scoped weapon
Sprinting and steadying your aim consume AP continually. Power Attacks and actions performed during V.A.T.S. consume a set amount each time they're used. Weapons with a slower attack speed tend to consume more AP.
When your AP is depleted, none of these actions can be performed until the required amount regenerates.
Many factors can affect your AP:
- Agility determines your total AP - Endurance slows the rate of AP consumption when sprinting - Perks grant permanent or situational bonuses - Consumable items can grant temporary bonuses
Your total AP is listed in the Pip-Boy on the Stat tab. When consumed, your AP displays on screen until fully recovered.
String.Dest:
Akční body (AB) představují míru tvojí fyzické energie. AB jsou používány pro:
- Sprint - Silný útok - Provádění útoků a přebíjení ve V.A.T.S. - Stabilitu míření při používání zbraní s optikou
Sprintování a stabilizace zaměřování spotřebovává AB průběžně. Silné útoky a úkony prováděné v prostředí V.A.T.S. spotřebovávají určité množství pokaždé, když jsou použity. Zbraně s pomalejší rychlostí útoku obvykle spotřebovávají více AB.
Když jsou tvé AB vyčerpány, nemůže být žádná z těchto akcí použita, dokud se neobnoví jejich potřebné množství.
Řada faktorů ovlivňuje tvoje AB:
- Obratnost určuje celkový počet tvých AB - Odolnost zpomaluje rychlost spotřeby AB při sprintování - Perky poskytují stálé nebo situační bonusy - Konzumací některých drog a potravin lze získat dočasné bonusy
Celkový počet tvých AB je uveden v Pip-Boyovi v záložce Status. Když se spotřebují, objeví se aktuální AB na obrazovce, dokud nejsou plně obnoveny.

String.Source:
When faced with a locked door or container, you can attempt to pick the lock.
Locks range in difficulty: novice, advanced, expert, and master. Picking locks above novice difficulty requires ranks of the "Locksmith" perk.
To pick a lock, you must have at least one bobby pin in your inventory. Bobby pins can be purchased or found throughout the Commonwealth. Once you have a bobby pin, look at the locked door or container you want to pick and press [RWTPad_Center].
To pick the lock, swipe [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right] to rotate the bobby pin, then press [WTrigger] to rotate the screwdriver.
If the lock resists, release [WTrigger] and reposition the bobby pin before trying again. The closer the bobby pin is to the correct position, the further the lock will rotate before you either encounter resistance or the bobby pin breaks.
When the bobby pin is in the correct position, the lock will fully rotate and open. More difficult locks require more precise placement of the bobby pin.
Press [WGrip] to exit lockpicking.
Some locks require a key or cannot be opened through lockpicking. "Inaccessible" locks typically require a terminal or a different outside source to access.
Locks that are owned display red unlock text. Picking a lock on an owned door or container is a crime. If you are detected, nearby onlookers will become hostile to you.
String.Dest:

String.Source: To select a destination for the Vertibird, bring up the Pip-Boy map.
String.Dest: To select a destination for the Vertibird, bring up the Pip-Boy map.

String.Source:
Scrapping allows you to break down unwanted weapons and armor into components. You can also scrap structures and objects in workshop locations.
To scrap a weapon or armor piece, visit a workbench, select the item and press [WTPad_Left]. Scrapping an item destroys it, along with any attached mods.
You cannot scrap Legendary items.
To scrap a structure in a workshop location, enter the Workshop menu by holding [LWMenu], highlight the structure you wish to scrap and press [RWTPad_Left]. The resulting components will be placed in the workshop's inventory.
String.Dest:
Scrapping allows you to break down unwanted weapons and armor into components. You can also scrap structures and objects in workshop locations.
To scrap a weapon or armor piece, visit a workbench, select the item and press [WTPad_Left]. Scrapping an item destroys it, along with any attached mods.
You cannot scrap Legendary items.
To scrap a structure in a workshop location, enter the Workshop menu by holding [LWMenu], highlight the structure you wish to scrap and press [RWTPad_Left]. The resulting components will be placed in the workshop's inventory.

String.Source: From the Maps tab, select a map marker and press [WTrigger] to fast travel to that location.
String.Dest: From the Maps tab, select a map marker and press [WTrigger] to fast travel to that location.

String.Source:
Drug use is prevalent throughout the Commonwealth. "Chems" like Jet, Psycho, and Mentats to name a few, can be consumed to provide temporary stat bonuses and beneficial effects.
However, every time you take chems, you risk becoming addicted, which carries with it a stat penalty (the penalty varies based on the chem involved).
Consuming the item you're addicted to will temporarily remove the penalty, but to get rid of it permanently, you'll have to visit a doctor or take the medicine Addictol.
Unlike other chems, Stimpaks and RadAway do not cause addiction.
You can also make your own chems by visiting a Chemistry station.
String.Dest:
Užívání drog je v Commonwealthu velmi rozšířené. „Chemikálie“ jako například jet, psycho a mentaty, mohou být požity pro získání dočasných bonusů a prospěšných účinků.
Avšak pokaždé, když požiješ drogy, vystavuješ se riziku vypěstování závislosti, která s sebou nese postih ke statistikám (postihy jsou různé, záleží, o jaké látky se jedná).
Požití látky, na kterou máš závislost, tento postih dočasně odstraní, aby se ho však bylo možno zbavit nastálo, budeš muset navštívit doktora nebo použít lék Denarkol.
Na rozdíl od jiných chemikálií, stimpaky a rad-away závislost nezpůsobují.
Můžeš si také vyrobit svoje vlastní drogy v chemické laboratoři.

String.Source: Point at different enemies to target them. Press [RWTrigger] to fire your gun, or swing your melee weapon.
String.Dest: Point at different enemies to target them. Press [RWTrigger] to fire your gun, or swing your melee weapon.

String.Source: Face your companion and press [RWTPad_Center] to begin issuing commands.
String.Dest: Face your companion and press [RWTPad_Center] to begin issuing commands.

String.Source: On the Inventory (INV) tab, you can favorite items by pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting FAV.
String.Dest: On the Inventory (INV) tab, you can favorite items by pressing [WTPad_Center] and selecting FAV.

String.Source:
LOCKPICKING Adjust the bobby pin by swiping [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right].
Press [WTrigger] to rotate the screwdriver.
If the spot you've chosen is correct, the lock will rotate and open.
If the lock resists, release [WTrigger] and swipe [WTPad_Left] and [WTPad_Right] to reposition the bobby pin.

String.Source:
Cooking stations allow you to craft food items which, when consumed, can boost stats, restore lost health, or grant temporary beneficial effects. All cooking recipes require ingredients, which can be purchased or found throughout the world.
At a cooking station, you can navigate between recipes or recipe categories swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. To select a category or a recipe, press [WTrigger].
Recipes Select a category to enter the Recipes menu.
If you have the ingredients required for a recipe in your inventory or in storage at the cooking station, select the recipe and press [WTrigger]. This will consume the ingredients and craft your food.
If you lack the ingredients necessary to cook a specific recipe, select it in Recipes menu and press [WTPad_Right] to tag the recipe's ingredients for search.
Tagged ingredients will appear in the world with a small magnifying glass next to their name when approached.
Storage You can also store ingredients in a cooking station by approaching it and pressing [RWTPad_Up] to open the station's Transfer menu. When cooking a recipe, ingredients stored in a cooking station will be used before those in your inventory.
For more info on how to use the Transfer menu, check out the "Containers" entry.
String.Dest:

String.Source:
Fallout VR has introduced a host of immersive changes to The Wasteland. Here is what you need to know to get right into the action.
Movement Press [RWTPad_Left] or [RWTPad_Right] to rotate left or right. Press and release [LWTrigger] in Teleport mode, or touch [LWTPad_Up] in Direct Movement Mode to travel around. When teleporting, hold [LWTrigger] and place the teleport indicator at the location you want to move to, then release [LWTrigger]. Note that teleporting too far or too quickly will consume stamina.
Combat Navigate to the INV tab in the Pip-Boy by clicking [LWTPad_Right]. Select a weapon and press [LWTPad_Center] to equip it. For ranged weapons, aim down the sights and press [RWTrigger] to fire. For melee weapons, simply swing the weapon at your target. Hold [RWTrigger] while swinging to power attack.
Interaction Press [WTPad_Center] to interact with objects and survivors. If any special interaction can be taken, it will appear around the touchpad.
String.Dest:

String.Source: Face your dog and press [RWTPad_Center] to begin issuing commands.
String.Dest: Face your dog and press [RWTPad_Center] to begin issuing commands.

String.Source:
The Commonwealth is a dangerous place to travel unarmed. Luckily, you'll find plenty of weapons scattered throughout the world and available for purchase in settlements.
There are three primary types of weapons:
- Guns - ranged weapons that require ammunition to fire
- Melee - close quarters weaponry, such as knives, swords, hammers, etc.
- Unarmed - bare fists, brass knuckles, boxing gloves, and similar armaments
Equipping Weapons To equip a weapon, bring up the Pip-Boy and swipe to the Inventory (INV) tab by pressing [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right]. Swipe [WTPad_Left] or [WTPad_Right] to select the Weapons section.
The Weapons section lists all the weapons currently in your inventory. Scroll through your inventory with [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down]. Press [WTrigger] to equip the item.
Weapon Stats While in the Weapons category in the Pip-Boy, the stats for the currently selected weapon will appear on the right side of the screen.
- Damage - the amount of damage the weapon does per hit
- Ammo - the type of ammunition this weapon requires and the amount you have available
- Fire Rate - how quickly the weapon can be fired
- Range - the furthest distance at which hits will do full damage
- Accuracy - a weapon's ability to hit where it's aimed
- Value - what the weapon is worth
- Weight - how heavy the weapon is
The weight of your weapon also affects your movement speed while the weapon is drawn. Hold [RWTPad_Center] and press [RWGrip] to holster your weapon and restore your speed.
If any of the currently selected weapon's stats are superior to those of your equipped weapon, one or more "+" symbols will appear next to the superior stat. If the selected weapon's stats are worse, one or more "-" symbols will appear.
Damage Types There are four types of damage a weapon can inflict:
- Ballistic - Energy (includes laser, plasma, flame and frost damage) - Radiation - Poison
The icon (or icons) next to a weapon's "Damage" stat indicates what type of damage the selected weapon will do.
Mods The majority of weapons can be modded. To check out what mods are available for a given weapon, visit a Weapons workbench.
See the "Mods" entry for more information about building mods.

String.Source:
As you complete quests, defeat enemies, and explore the world, you'll earn Experience Points (XP). Once you've gained sufficient XP, your level will increase. Every level you gain provides:
- Additional Hit Points (based on your Endurance attribute) - A new perk
You can select your new perk immediately by visiting the Perk chart or save it for later. Your level (along with your SPECIAL attritbutes) determines what perks you can take.
To enter the Perk chart, bring up the Pip-Boy, navigate to the Status screen, then press [LWTPad_Center].
String.Dest:

- Additional Hit Points (based on your Endurance attribute) - A new perk
You can select your new perk immediately by visiting the Perk chart or save it for later. Your level (along with your SPECIAL attritbutes) determines what perks you can take.
To enter the Perk chart, bring up the Pip-Boy, navigate to the Status screen, then press [LWTPad_Center].

String.Source: To throw grenades or place mines, equip them in the Pip-Boy, then hold and release [RWGrip] while throwing.
String.Dest: To throw grenades or place mines, equip them in the Pip-Boy, then hold and release [RWGrip] while throwing.

String.Source:
Use the Map tab to get a bird's-eye view of the Commonwealth on the World Map or check out a local map of your current location. To switch between map views, press [WTPad_Center] and select LOCAL MAP.
Your current location on the map is marked by an arrow. Quest targets for active quests will also appear on the map.
To adjust your view, swipe [WTPad_Any] to move the map. press [WTPad_Center] to zoom in and out.
World Map Icons The icons on the World Map represent settlements, outposts, and other areas of interest.
Icons for locations you haven't visited will appear as outlines. The icons of locations you have visited will appear filled-in.
Fast Travel From the World Map, you can fast travel to any location you've previously visited. To fast travel to a location, select it with the cursor, press [WTrigger] and select "Fast Travel."
Custom Markers You can also place custom markers on the map, which will then appear on your compass as you travel the world.
To place a custom marker, move your cursor to the desired spot on the map and press [WTrigger]. To remove a custom marker, move the cursor to an empty spot and press [WTrigger], then select "Remove Marker."
String.Dest:

String.Source:
To attack with a melee weapon, swing it at an enemy.
Raise your weapon horizontally to block incoming melee attacks. Successfully blocked attacks do reduced damage and have a chance to cause your opponent to briefly stagger. Projectiles cannot be blocked.
To perform a Power Attack with a melee weapon, hold [RWTrigger] while swinging. Performing a Power Attack consumes Action Points, but successful Power Attacks deal extra damage and cause an enemy to stagger. Power Attacks with heavy melee weapons can even break through an enemy's block.
Most melee weapons also create significantly less sound than guns, making them ideal for use while sneaking.
Increase your effectiveness in melee combat by raising your Strength attribute or wearing Power Armor.
String.Dest:

You cannot wait while enemies are nearby.

String.Source:
Alongside your standard weapon, you can also equip a single type of grenade or mine.
To use an equipped grenade or mine, hold then release [RWGrip].
To equip a grenade or mine, bring up the Pip-Boy, then navigate to the Weapons section of Inventory (INV) tab. Select the item you'd like to equip by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger].
Deployed mines and tossed grenades can be targeted while in V.A.T.S. (even if you're the one who tossed/deployed them). See the "V.A.T.S." entry for more information.
String.Dest:

To use an equipped grenade or mine, hold then release [RWGrip].
To equip a grenade or mine, bring up the Pip-Boy, then navigate to the Weapons section of Inventory (INV) tab. Select the item you'd like to equip by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger].
Deployed mines and tossed grenades can be targeted while in V.A.T.S. (even if you're the one who tossed/deployed them). See the "V.A.T.S." entry for more information.

String.Source:
Components are the fundamental pieces that make up most items and gear in the Commonwealth. Components can be used to assemble mods at modding stations, build structures in the workshop, and are also necessary for crafting certain cooking and chems recipes.
Components are primarily harvested from Junk Items (steel from cans, springs from clocks, etc.). Any Junk Items you've collected will be listed in the Junk section of the Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab.
You can also scrap unwanted weapons and armor for components (see "Scrapping" below) or tear down unwanted structures through the workshop.
For more information on how to use the workshop, see the "Workshop - Menu" entry.
Using Components When making an object, whether it be at a modding or crafting station, or at a workshop, if you have Junk Items containing the required components in your inventory, those Junk Items will be turned automatically into components when your item is crafted.
Items containing components can also be stored directly in the station or workshop you're using. Stored items will be harvested for components before items in your inventory.
Tagging Components If you lack the components required for an object, you can tag components for search through the Pip-Boy Inventory (INV) tab.
To tag a component for search, enter the Junk section in the Inventory tab and press [WTPad_Center] and select COMPONENT VIEW to switch to Component view. This will list all the components currently available from the items in your inventory. To tag a specific component, select it and press [WTPad_Center] and select TAG FOR SEARCH.
Items containing tagged components will display a small magnifying glass next to their name when approached in the world.
While at a modding or crafting station, you can also tag specific mods or recipes. To tag a mod or recipe, select it from the Mods/Recipes menu and press [WTPad_Right]. This will tag all missing components required for the selected item.
Scrapping Any weapons and armor you've collected can also be broken down into components through scrapping.
To scrap equipment, visit a modding station. Select the item you wish to scrap on the station's Inventory page and press [WTPad_Left]. Note, scrapping an item destroys it and any mods attached to it.
You can also scrap unwanted structures in workshop areas. To scrap a structure, enter the Workshop menu, highlight the unwanted structure and press [WTPad_Left].
String.Dest:

String.Source:
The Stat tab contains information on your current status, SPECIAL attributes, and perks.
Status In the Status section, you can find your:
- Hit Points - Current level progress - Action Points - Damage of your equipped weapon - Damage resistance provided by equipped armor
As well, the Vault Boy at the center of the screen provides information about your current limb health. The small bars surrounding the Vault Boy represent the current health of each of your limbs. When a bar is empty, that limb is crippled and will be displayed on the Vault Boy.
See the "Limb Damage" entry for more information on the effects of crippling.
The Vault Boy will also display other status effects. If you've taken significant radiation damage, the Vault Boy will appear more Ghoulish. If you're currently under the influence of any chems or alcohol (or addicted), his tongue will hang out.
If you're suffering from crippled limbs, radiation damage, or any other wounds, you can treat them directly from the Status section. To heal lost health and damaged limbs, use a Stimpak if available. If you've taken radiation damage, you can use RadAway.
Active Effects If you have any active effects from chems, food, alcohol, or addiction, icons will be displayed on the left side of the screen.
SPECIAL The Special section lists your current SPECIAL attributes, as well as if you have any active attribute bonuses or penalties.
PERKS The Perks section lists all the perks you've acquired, their effects, and their current ranks.
String.Dest:

String.Source:
Any radio station broadcasting in your current area will be displayed on the Radio tab.
To tune to a station, select it by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger]. While a station is active, you can enter or exit the Pip-Boy and your selected station will continue to play.
To turn off a station, select it again and press [WTrigger].
String.Dest:
Any radio station broadcasting in your current area will be displayed on the Radio tab.
To tune to a station, select it by swiping [WTPad_Up] and [WTPad_Down] and press [WTrigger]. While a station is active, you can enter or exit the Pip-Boy and your selected station will continue to play.
To turn off a station, select it again and press [WTrigger].

String.Source:
The Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System - or V.A.T.S. - allows you to gain your bearings and selectively take out enimies.
To enter V.A.T.S., press [RWMenu]. While in V.A.T.S., time will slow, but you can still be damaged by incoming attacks.
To exit V.A.T.S., press [RWMenu] again.
Attacking in V.A.T.S. With a gun equipped you can attack specific limbs. You can even target mines and tossed grenades.
Do enough damage to a given limb and it will become crippled (see the "Limb Damage" entry for the effects of crippling).
Simply point and fire your gun to attack enemies. You will only be able to attack targets within your weapon's range, so if you're using a melee weapon, you'll have to sieze the gap with your enemy.
The number of attacks you can make is limited by your Action Points. By improving your Agility attribute, you can increase the number of attacks you can mark at one time.
Critical Hits Every successful hit made in V.A.T.S. fills your Critical meter. Once full, you can press [RWTPad_Center] to unleash a high-powered attack.
How quickly your Critical meter fills is determined by your Luck attribute.
String.Dest:
The Vault-Tec Assisted Targeting System - or V.A.T.S. - allows you to gain your bearings and selectively take out enimies.

How quickly your Critical meter fills is determined by your Luck attribute.

String.Source:
Is the struggle of this world merely a pleasant game for you? Do you long for a more brutal take on a life lived post apocalypse?
If you answered "Yes and yes!", then Survival difficulty is for you!
Survival upends many of the rules of life in the Commonwealth for maximum challenge. For a full list of these changes, see below.
To enable Survival, press [LWMenu], select "Settings," then "Gameplay" and choose "Survival" from the "Difficulty" options.
Survival: Basics
Saving Manual, quicksaving & most autosaves are disabled. To save your game, you'll need to find a bed and sleep for at least an hour.
Staying Healthy Survival makes it more challenging to keep yourself in top health and high spirits. Food and stimpaks heal at a significantly slower rate, and you'll need to pay attention to your overall wellness by staying properly fed, rested and hydrated. See "Survival: Healing Changes" and "Survival: Rest & Wellness" entries for more details.
Lethality You now deal, but also take, more damage. You can increase the damage you deal even further with "Adrenaline". See the "Survival: Combat & Adrenaline" entry for more details.
Fast Travel Fast Travel is disabled. If you wish to be somewhere, you'll have to get there the old-fashioned way.
Inventory Management You're able to carry far fewer items, including ammunition & Stimpaks, which now both have weight. Your companions can still help you carry the load, but their capacity has also been decreased. See the "Survival: Items & Companions" entry for more details.
Survival: Combat & Adrenaline
Adrenaline Survival automatically grants the Adrenaline perk, which provides a bonus to your damage output. Unlike other perks, the only way to increase your rank of the Adrenaline perk is by getting kills (hostile or otherwise). The higher your Adrenaline rank, the higher the damage bonus. Sleeping for any amount of time will cause your Adrenaline rank to lower, taking your damage bonus down with it. You can check your current Adrenaline rank at any time in the Perks section on the Stat tab in your Pip-Boy.
Compass Be sure to keep your eyes peeled, as enemies will no longer appear on your compass. The distance at which locations of interest will appear has been significantly shortened as well.
Combat In Survival, both you and your foes are deadlier than ever, so don't expect to survive more than a few hits from most enemies. Good armor, reliable cover, and tactical thinking are critical. Choose your openings wisely to make the most of your own increased damage.
Survival: Rest, Wellness & Fatigue
Bed Types The type of bed you're sleeping in determines the length of time you are able to stay asleep. A sleeping bag will save your game and may save your life when you're desperate. A mattress offers strong healing and can clear most of your fatigue. The comfort of a bed allows for a full night's rest and all the benefits that come with it.
Wellness You'll find it difficult to survive without taking proper care of yourself. You must stay hydrated, fed, and rested to remain combat-ready. Going for extended periods of time without food, water, or a good night's sleep will begin to adversely affect your health, hurting your SPECIAL stats, adding to your Fatigue (see "Fatigue" below), lowering your immunity (see "Illness" below), and eventually even dealing physical damage to you.
Fatigue Fatigue mostly comes from being tired, but both hunger and thirst also affect it. Fatigue works like radiation, but affects your Action Points (AP) rather than your Hit Points (HP). The more Fatigue you've built up, the less AP you'll have for actions like sprinting and VATS. The amount of Fatigue you've accumulated is displayed in red on your AP bar.
Survival: Illness & Health
Illness Eating uncooked meat, drinking unpurified water, taking damage from disease-ridden foes and using harmful Chems all put your body at increased risk for various ill effects. When you are afflicted with an Illness, a message will appear onscreen. You can check specifics about your current Illnesses by navigating to the Status section of your Pip-Boy's Stat tab and pressing [LWTPad_Center] to view your active effects.
Illnesses Insomnia: You get less sleep than desired. Lethargy: Your AP regenerates much more slowly. Fatigue: You need to sleep more frequently. Parasites: It takes more food than normal to satiate your hunger. Weakness: Your body can't handle as much damage as normal. Infection: You take damage as the infection spreads.
Doctors Doctors can heal your wounds, cure your addictions, and banish diseases... for a price. You can find a doctor in most major settlements.
Antibiotics Antibiotics, which can be crafted at Chem Stations, purchased from doctors or found in medical containers, instantly heal the various effects of Illness.
Herbal Remedies Herbal Remedies, which can be crafted at Chem Stations, purchased from vendors & doctors and found in various containers significantly lower your chances of developing particular Illnesses.
Suppressed Immunity Items that cleanse your body of Rads come with the cost of making you tired and temporarily damaging your immunity, leaving you more vulnerable to Illness than usual.
Survival: Healing Changes
Slower Healing In Survival, the rate at which restorative items, like Stimpaks and food, recover your health is significantly reduced. You'll need to time your healing precisely if you hope to last.
Crippled Limbs Crippled limbs will no longer auto-heal after combat, and will remain crippled until healed by a Stimpak.
Companion Healing If your companion goes down during combat, you must heal them before they can get back up. If you leave the area without healing them, they will return home to recover.
Survival: Hunger, Thirst, Food & Beverages
Food / Drink Value Looking at an item's value is a good way to determine how much that item will counter your thirst and hunger.
Food Bonus Effects A food's bonus effects, such as increased carry weight from Radstag steak, will only apply if eaten when you are not currently hungry. Make sure to take care of the basics before eating for bonuses.
Counter Effects Keep in mind, certain items may not give you the results you expect. For example, Chems and Alcohol dehydrate, Caffeine makes you hungry, etc.
Caffeinated Caffeine gives you a short reprieve from your tiredness, possibly buying you time to finish a fight or find a bed.
Survival: Items & Companions
Weighted Ammo Bullets and shells now all have a small amount of weight, which varies by caliber. Heavier items such as fusion cores, rockets, and mini-nukes can really drag you down.
Carry Weight In Survival, both you and your companion's Carry Weight has been significantly reduced. Exceeding your carry weight reduces your Endurance and Agility stats, and periodically damages your legs and health. Think of your back!
Companions Carry weight for companions has been decreased. Companions will also no longer automatically get back up if downed during combat and will return home if abandoned without being healed.
Enemy and Loot Repopulation Locations you've cleared will now repopulate with new enemies and loot at a significantly slower rate.
Strong Back Instead of allowing Fast Travel, with Strong Back Rank 4, you no longer take damage from exceeding your carry weight.
String.Dest:
Jsou nástrahy tohoto světa pro tebe pouhou procházkou růžovým sadem? Dychtíš po brutálnějším pojetí života v postapokalypse?
Odpovídáš-li „Ano a ano!“, pak je obtížnost Přežití přesně pro tebe!
Obtížnost Přežití přichází pro poskytnutí maximální výzvy hned s několika pravidly života v Commonwealthu. Úplný výpis pravidel najdeš níže.
Pro zapnutí Přežití stiskni [LWMenu], vyber „Nastavení“, pak „Hra“ a zvol „Přežití“ z dostupných úrovní „Obtížnosti“.
Přežití: Základy
Ukládání Ruční, rychlé a většina automatických ukládání je zakázána. Pro uložení hry musíš najít postel a spát v ní alespoň jednu hodinu.
Udržení zdraví Udržet si silné zdraví a dobrou formu je při Přežití velká výzva. Jídlo a stimpaky obnovují zdraví v omezené míře a zvláštní pozornost musíš věnovat pravidelné stravě, pití a spánku. Viz záznamy pro „Přežití: změny ve zdraví“ a „Přežití: odpočinek a základní potřeby“.
Smrtelnost Při Přežití působíš ty, ale i tví nepřátelé, větší poškození. Udělované poškození můžeš zvýšit ještě více pomocí „adrenalinu“. Viz záznam „Přežití: souboj a adrenalin“.
Rychlé cestování Rychlé cestování je zakázáno. Pokud si přeješ někde být, musíš se tam dostat pěkně po staru.
Inventář Uneseš o dost méně předmětů, včetně munice a stimpaků, kdy oboje má hmotnost. S nákladem ti mohou pomoci tví společníci, ale i jejich nosnost je omezena. Viz „Přežití: předměty a společníci“
Přežití: Souboj a adrenalin
Adrenalin Přežití automaticky uděluje perk Adrenalin, který přidává bonus k udělovanému poškození. Pro zvýšení úrovně perku, na rozdíl od ostatních perků, je nutné zabíjet (nepřátele a ostatní). Čím vyšší je úroveň, tím vyšší je bonus k poškození. Spánek na libovolně krátkou dobu úroveň adrenalinu, a tím i bonus k poškození snižuje. V Pip-Boyovi v sekci Perků na záložce statistik můžeš úroveň adrenalinu kdykoliv zkontrolovat.
Kompas Měj oči otevřené, protože nepřátelé se na tvém kompasu již nebudou zobrazovat. Významně je snížena i vzdálenost, na kterou se vykreslují lokace zájmu.
Souboj Při Přežití jsi ty i tví nepřátelé mnohem více smrtelnější, a proto neočekávej, že od většiny nepřátel přežiješ víc než jen pár zásahů. Dobrá zbroj, spolehlivé krytí a taktické myšlení jsou klíčové. Své výpady si dobře naplánuj, ať využiješ maximum ze svého zvýšeného poškození.
Přežití: Odpočinek, základní potřeby a únava
Typy postelí Typ postele, do které si lehneš, ovlivňuje maximální délku nerušeného spánku. Spací pytel uloží hru a třeba i zachrání život, pokud jsi v zoufalé situaci. Matrace vyléčí závažnější zranění a zbaví tě velké části únavy. Pohodlí postele poskytuje nerušený spánek skrze celou noc a benefity s ním spojené.
Základní potřeby Přežití je velmi obtížné, pokud se o sebe nezvládneš patřičně starat. Pro uchování bojeschopnosti musíš dodržovat pitný režim a pravidelně jíst a odpočívat. Při delším čase bez jídla, vody nebo poctivého spánku začneš pociťovat negativní účinky na svém zdraví, zhoršení SPECIAL vlastností a zvýšení únavy (viz „Únava“ níže), sníženou imunitu (viz „Nemoci“ níže) a postupně i pravidelné fyzické poškození.
Únava Únava pochází většinou z nedostatku spánku, ale vliv na ni má jak hlad, tak i žízeň. Únava funguje podobně jako radiace, ale místo bodů zdraví (BZ) ovlivňuje akční body (AB). Čím více obdržíš únavy, tím budeš mít méně dostupných AB pro akce jako sprintování nebo režim V.A.T.S. Celková úroveň únavy je zobrazena v červené barvě na liště AB.
Přežití: Nemoci a zdraví
Nemoci Konzumace syrového masa, pití nevyčištěné vody, zásah od nemocemi prolezlých nepřátel a užívání škodlivých chemikálií zvyšují riziko onemocnění. V případě nákazy je na obrazovce zobrazena krátká zpráva. Detaily nemoci si pak můžeš prohlédnout v Pip-Boyovi v sekci Stav v rámci záložky statistik po stisknutí [LWTPad_Center] na zobrazení aktivních účinků.
Nákazy Nespavost: Je ti dopřáno méně spánku, než je potřeba. Letargie: Tvé AB jsou doplňovány o dost pomaleji. Vyčerpání: Musíš spát více často. Paraziti: Pro nasycení musíš zkonzumovat víc jídla než obvykle. Slabost: Tvé tělo nevydrží takové poškození jako obvykle. Infekce: Šířící se infekce tě pomalu zraňuje.
Doktoři Doktoři mohou vyléčit tvá zranění, zbavit tě závislostí a uzdravit od nemocí... za peníze. Doktory najdeš ve většině velkých osad.
Antibiotika Antibiotika, můžeš vyrábět v chemické laboratoři, kupovat od doktorů nebo najít v lékařských kontejnerech; okamžitě léčí různé účinky onemocnění.
Bylinné prostředky Bylinné prostředky lze vyrábět v chemické laboratoři, kupovat od obchodníků a doktorů nebo najít v rozličných kontejnerech; významně snižují šance nákazy specifických onemocnění.
Snížená imunita Předměty pro léčbu ozáření způsobují zvýšenou únavu a dočasné snížení imunity, a tak tě i vystavují vyššímu riziku onemocnění.
Přežití: Výzvy při léčení
Pomalejší léčení Při Přežití je výrazně snížena rychlost, se kterou působí léčebné prostředky, jako jsou stimpaky nebo jídlo. Chceš-li přežít, musíš si své léčení dobře rozplánovat.
Ochromené končetiny Ochromené končetiny se po ukončení boje samy neuzdraví a do vyléčení stimpakem zůstanou ochromené.
Léčení společníků Pokud je v boji tvůj společník sražen k zemi, musíš ho vyléčit, aby se mohl vrátit zpátky na nohy. Pokud opustíš oblast bez vyléčení raněného společníka, tak se sám vydá domů.
Přežití: Hlad, žízeň a nápoje
Jídlo / hodnota pití Hodnota předmětu je dobrým indikátorem toho, jak výrazně předmět při konzumaci ovlivní tvůj hlad a žízeň.
Bonusové účinky jídla Bonusové účinky jídla jako například zvýšená nosnost u steaku z mutajelena, jsou aplikovány pouze tehdy, nemáš-li při jejich konzumaci hlad. Vždy dbej na vyřešení svých základních potřeb, než začneš jíst kvůli bonusům.
Negativní účinky Pamatuj, že některé předměty mohou poskytovat neočekávané účinky. Například chemikálie nebo alkohol dehydrují, kofein způsobuje hlad atd.
Kofein Kofein krátkodobě vysvobozuje z ospalosti, čímž může poskytnout čas pro dokončení souboje nebo nalezení postele.
Přežití: Předměty a společníci
Hmotnost munice Náboje a střelivo mají malou hmotnost určenou svým kalibrem. Těžší předměty jako fúzní jádra, rakety nebo mini atomovky tě zase o dost více zatíží.
Nosnost Při Přežití je výrazně omezena nosnost tvá i tvého společníka. Překročení nosnosti snižuje odolnost a hbitost a periodicky poškozuje nohy a zdraví. Mysli na svá záda!
Společníci Nosnost společníků je snížena. Společníci se v boji vlastními silami nezvednou ze země. V případě opuštění raněného společníka se pak sami vrátí domů.
Nepřátelé a objevování kořisti Ve vyčištěných lokacích se nepřátelé a kořist znovu objevují ve výrazně snížené frekvenci.
Stěhovák Místo rychlého cestování s perkem Stěhovák na 4. úrovni, na tebe nebude působit poškození při překročení nosnosti.

String.Source: Place the teleport marker on the surface you wish to jump to, or press [LWTrigger] if in direct movement mode to jump.
String.Dest: Umísti teleportační značku na povrch, na který chceš vyskočit, nebo stiskni [LWTrigger], pokud jsi v režimu přímé chůze.

String.Source: Quickly teleport in a direction, or press [LWTPad_Up] in Direct Movement Mode, to sprint. Sprinting consumes Action Points.
String.Dest: Quickly teleport in a direction, or press [LWTPad_Up] in Direct Movement Mode, to sprint. Sprinting consumes Action Points.

String.Source: Press [LWTPad_Up] to sprint. Sprinting consumes Action Points.
String.Dest: Pro sprint stiskni [LWTPad_Up]. Sprintování spotřebovává akční body.

String.Source: Favorite an item in the Pip-Boy then hold [RWTPad_Center] to bring up the favorites menu. Highlight and release on the item you wish to use with [WTPad_Any].
String.Dest: Favorite an item in the Pip-Boy then hold [RWTPad_Center] to bring up the favorites menu. Highlight and release on the item you wish to use with [WTPad_Any].

String.Source: To swim, submerge your head underwater, or press [LWGrip], and press [LWTrigger] and [RWTrigger] while moving your hands front to back.
String.Dest: Pro plavání ponoř hlavu pod vodní hladinu, nebo stiskni [LWGrip], a stiskni [LWTrigger] a [RWTrigger] při pohybu rukama zepředu dozadu.

String.Source: Place the teleport marker on the surface you wish to jump to.
String.Dest: Umísti teleportační značku na povrch, na který chceš vyskočit.

String.Source: Physically crouch to enter Sneak Mode.
String.Dest: Physically crouch to enter Sneak Mode.

String.Source: Physically crouch, or press [LWGrip] if using Comfort Sneak, to enter Sneak Mode.
String.Dest: Physically crouch, or press [LWGrip] if using Comfort Sneak, to enter Sneak Mode.

String.Source: While in workshop mode use [LWTrigger] to teleport.
String.Dest: While in workshop mode use [LWTrigger] to teleport.

String.Source: Press [RWTPad_Left] or [RWTPad_Right] to rotate left or right.
String.Dest: Press [RWTPad_Left] or [RWTPad_Right] to rotate left or right.

String.Source: Do you want to change anything?

While cryogenically frozen in Vault 111, I awoke just long enough to witness the murder of my wife and the abduction of my infant son. I need to escape Vault 111 and return home, so I can begin to make sense of this tragedy.
String.Dest: V rámci kryogenického spánku ve Vaultu 111 jsem se probudil na dostatečně dlouhou dobu, abych byl svědkem zavraždění mé ženy a únosu mého syna. Musím utéct z Vaultu 111 a dostat se domů, kde bych snad mohl postupně porozumět téhle tragédii.

String.Source: I've helped Preston Garvey and the people under his care settle in a new home in Sanctuary.
String.Dest: S mou pomocí se Preston Garvey a jeho lidé usadili v novém domově v Sanctuary.

String.Source: I've made it inside the Museum of Freedom in Concord, where a man is defending a group of people against armed thugs.
String.Dest: Podařilo se mi dostat do Muzea svobody v Concordu, kde jeden muž brání skupinu lidí proti ozbrojeným zabijákům.

String.Source: I've reached Concord, the closest neighborhood next to my old home. Maybe there are other survivors here?
String.Dest: Jsem v Concordu, nejbližším městu k mému starému domu. Možná tu jsou nějací přeživší?

String.Source: Codsworth suggests we search the old neighborhood for any sign of Shaun. It's as good a plan as any.
String.Dest: Codsworth navrhuje, abychom prohledali staré sousedství k nalezení stop po Shaunovi. Je to stejně dobrý plán jako kterýkoliv jiný.

String.Source: Preston Garvey wants me to deal with the Raiders in Concord for good. He says there's a suit of Power Armor on the roof I can use, if I can find a Fusion Core for it.
String.Dest: Preston Garvey po mně chce, aby bylo s nájezdníky v Concordu skoncováno. Říká, že na střeše je energozbroj, kterou můžu použít, pokud pro ni najdu fúzní jádro.

String.Source: I've made it out of Vault 111, only to find the world I knew completely destroyed by nuclear war. I need to head home, and see if there's anything left.
String.Dest: Jsem venku z Vaultu 111 a nacházím jen svět kompletně zničený atomovou válkou. Musím zamířit domů a zjistit, jestli vůbec něco zbylo.

String.Source: Preston Garvey has asked me to join him and the other settlers in Sanctuary.
String.Dest: Preston Garvey mě požádal o spolupráci s ním a s ostatními osadníky v Sanctuary.

String.Source: Concord is safe. Preston Garvey will want to hear about this.
String.Dest: Concord je v bezpečí. Preston Garvey si to bude chtít poslechnout.

String.Source: The Museum of Freedom is safe, for the moment. I should check on the people who are trapped on the top floor.
String.Dest: Muzeum svobody je pro tuto chvíli v bezpečí. Je třeba zkontrolovat ty lidi uvězněné v horním patře.

String.Source: I've met Preston Garvey, who says he's a member of the Commonwealth Minutemen. He wants my help.
String.Dest: Preston Garvey, jenž tvrdí, že je členem commonwealthských Minutemanů, mě žádá o pomoc.

String.Source: I haven't found Shaun yet, but I did meet a desparate man in need of help. What kind of world have I woken up to?
String.Dest: Najít Shauna se mi ještě nepodařilo, ale potkat člověka zoufale potřebujícího pomoc ano. Do jakého světa se mi to podařilo probudit?

String.Source: Preston Garvey has asked me to join him and the other settlers in Sanctuary.
String.Dest: Preston Garvey mě požádal o spolupráci s ním a s ostatními osadníky v Sanctuary.

String.Source: I've heard of a group called the Minutemen, a volunteer army devoted to helping others. The last of them are said to be making their way to Concord.
String.Dest: Donesly se ke mně zvěsti o Minutemanech, dobrovolnické armádě zasvěcené pomoci druhým. Říká se, že poslední z nich míří do Concordu.

String.Source: A man is protecting a group of people inside the Museum of Freedom in Concord. He pleaded for me to help him fend off their attackers.
String.Dest: Nějaký muž brání skupinku lidí v Muzeu svobody v Concordu. Prosí mě o pomoc při snaze odrazit útok vedený na jejich pozici.

String.Source: The people under attack inside the Museum are pinned down inside a room. They won't open the door until all their attackers are dealt with.
String.Dest: Ti lidé v muzeu jsou uzavřeni v jedné místnosti. Neotevřou dveře, dokud nebudou útočníci zlikvidováni.

String.Source: I've made it back to the old neighborhood. Surprisingly, Codsworth is still where I left him, and completely operational. I should talk with him, and see what he knows.
String.Dest: Podařilo se mi dostat zpátky do staré čtvrti. Kupodivu je Codsworth stále tam, kde zůstal, a je plně funkční. Bylo by dobré si s ním promluvit a zjistit, co všechno ví.

String.Source: The search of the old neighborhood came up empty, so Codsworth suggested I continue looking in Concord, the next town over.
String.Dest: Prohledání staré čtvrti vyšlo naprázdno a Codsworth navrhuje pokračovat ve vedlejším městě, Concordu.

String.Source: Preston Garvey wants me to deal with the Raiders in Concord for good.
String.Dest: Preston Garvey po mně chce, aby bylo s nájezdníky v Concordu skoncováno.

String.Source: While cryogenically frozen in Vault 111, I awoke just long enough to witness the murder of my husband and the abduction of my infant son. I need to escape Vault 111 and return home, so I can begin to make sense of this tragedy.
String.Dest: V rámci kryogenického spánku ve Vaultu 111 jsem se probudila na dostatečně dlouhou dobu, abych byla svědkem zavraždění mého muže a únosu mého syna. Musím utéct z Vaultu 111 a dostat se domů, kde bych snad mohla postupně porozumět téhle tragédii.

String.Source: You can't do that in Power Armor. Hold [LWTPad_Center] to Exit.
String.Dest: You can't do that in Power Armor. Hold [LWTPad_Center] to Exit.

String.Source:
The workshop allows you to build, adjust, and remove nearby objects and structures.
Use [LWTrigger] while in Workshop Mode to teleport.
Move between options by swiping [LWTPad_Left] and [LWTPad_Right]. Click [LWTPad_Up] to find the object or structure you wish to build. If your selected object appears green, press [LWTrigger] to build it. If it appears red, try adjusting its location (and yours) until it changes to green.
Workshop objects are built from components. When building an object, components are automatically harvested from Junk Items in your inventory or the workshop's.
String.Dest:
The workshop allows you to build, adjust, and remove nearby objects and structures.
Use [LWTrigger] while in Workshop Mode to teleport.
Move between options by swiping [LWTPad_Left] and [LWTPad_Right]. Click [LWTPad_Up] to find the object or structure you wish to build. If your selected object appears green, press [LWTrigger] to build it. If it appears red, try adjusting its location (and yours) until it changes to green.
Workshop objects are built from components. When building an object, components are automatically harvested from Junk Items in your inventory or the workshop's.
